oecd-FFS_FFSO_PSE_PC.source:
OECD Inventory of Support Measures for Fossil Fuels

http://www.oecd.org/fossil-fuels/data/

egov-egr.def: The E-Government Development Index is a weighted average of the Online Service Index, the Telecommunication Infrastructure Index, and the Human Capital Index.

egov-egi.def: The E-Government Development Index is a weighted average of the Online Service Index, the Telecommunication Infrastructure Index, and the Human Capital Index.

egov-epi.def: The E-Participation Index is a subset of the Online Service Index realted to e-decision making, e-consultation, and e-informatino.

egov-osi.def: The online service index measures the use of ICTs by governments based on a survey of the online presence of Member States.

egov-hci.def: The human capital index is an average of four indicators, including adult literacy rate, gross enrollment ratio, estimated years of schooling, and mean years of schooling.

egov-tii.def: This index is an average of five indicators per 100 inhabitants, including estimated Internet users, number of main fixed telephone lines, number of mobile subscribers, number of wireless broadband subscriptions, and number of fixed broadband subscriptions.

ihme-acnevulgaris.def:
Acne vulgaris (or acne) is a chronic inflammatory disease of the pilosebaceous unit associated with an increase in sebum secretion (ICD-10: L70, excluding L70.4).
Globally, acne vulgaris was responsible for 4·96 million (95% UI 2·98–7·85) DALYs in 2019. Of these, 3·52 million (2·11–5·64) DALYs occurred in those ages 15–49 years old.

ihme-acuteglomerulonephritis.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from acute episodes of inflammation and injury to the filtering units of the kidney (glomeruli), generally resulting in haematuria, oedema, and hypertension.
722 000 cases (95% UI 595 000–878 000) of acute glomerulonephritis occurred in 2019, resulting in 10 500 deaths (7200–12 200) and 307 000 global DALYs (204 000–363 000).

ihme-acutehepatitis.def:
Hepatitis is a viral infection that can lead to inflammation of the liver. This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from acute hepatitis A, B, C, and E.
Acute hepatitis resulted in 4·35 million (95% UI 3·57–5·22) global DALYs in 2019. Acute hepatitis A, B, C, and E contributed 53·9% (42·9–63·6), 37·2% (27·8–47·4), 5·8% (3·4–8·8), and 3·0% (2·1–4·0) to DALYs for the acute hepatitis parent, respectively.

ihme-adverseeffectsofmedicaltreatment.def:
Death or short-term or long-term disability sustained as the result of undergoing a procedure, treatment, or other exposure to the health-care system. This exposure can occur in inpatient admission, outpatient facilities, emergency care, or during home treatment.
Adverse effects of medical treatment were responsible for 106 000 deaths (95% UI 89 100–117 000) in 2019. The age-standardised mortality rate decreased from 1·5 per 100 000 (1·3–1·7) in 2010 to 1·4 per 100 000 (1·1–1·5) in 2019.

ihme-africantrypanosomiasis.def:
HAT, also known as sleeping sickness, is a vector-borne disease caused by two subspecies of Trypanosoma brucei, T.b. gambiense and T.b. rhodesiense. HAT progresses from skin manifestations that include severe itching to severe neurological symptoms.
The global burden of human African trypanosomiasis (HAT) in 2019 was 82 600 DALYs (95% UI 37 600–156 000) and 1360 deaths (95% UI 609–2580), a 98% decrease in deaths since 1990, reflecting efforts to eliminate transmission and improve case detection.

ihme-agerelatedandotherhearingloss.def:
Age-related and other hearing loss includes causes not identified as meningitis, chronic otitis media, or congenital. The dominant cause is presbycusis, the gradual loss of hearing with age caused by the breakdown of neurons in the inner ear.
In 2019, age-related and other hearing loss resulted in 40·2 million (95% UI 27·4–57·1) YLDs. It was the fourth-ranked cause of YLDs in 2019 for non-communicable diseases.

ihme-alcoholusedisorders.def:
Alcohol use disorders includes deaths assigned to alcohol use disorders or accidental poisoning by alcohol codes and cases of alcohol dependence, a substance-related disorder involving a dysfunctional pattern of alcohol use, and fetal alcohol syndrome.
Alcohol use disorders was responsible for an estimated 17·0 million (95% UI 13·5–21·5) DALYs globally in 2019. The highest prevalence rates were seen among individuals 30 to 39 years old. Prevalence of alcohol use disorders was 2·39 times (2·21–2·57) greater in males than females.

ihme-alopeciaareata.def:
Alopecia areata is an autoimmune disease that results in hair loss on the scalp and other parts of the body (ICD-10: L63).
Globally, alopecia was responsible for 601 000 DALYs (95% UI 378 000–891 000) in 2019. Of that, 410 000 DALYs (258 000–609 000) occurred in those 15 to 49 years old.

ihme-animalcontact.def:
Animal contact includes deaths and injuries resulting from unintentionally being attacked, struck, impaled, bitten, stung, crushed, exposed to, or stepped on by a non-human animal. Included are ICD-9: E905–E906.99, ICD-10: W52.0–W62.9, W64–W64.9, X20–X29.9.
Animal contact (venomous and non-venomous) caused 93 500 deaths (95% UI 61 900–114 000) in 2019. 67·7% (58·2–72·2) of global deaths occurred in south Asia. Age-standardised death rates decreased by 15·9% (-25·6 to -1·8) between 2010 and 2019.

ihme-anxietydisorders.def:
Anxiety disorders incorporate disability caused by experiences of intense fear and distress in combination with other physiological symptoms.
Anxiety disorders resulted in 28·7 million (95% UI 19·9–39·3) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 1·1% (0·8–1·5) of DALYs. Anxiety disorders contributed to 22·9% (18·6–27·5) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

ihme-aorticaneurysm.def:
Aortic aneurysms represent full-thickness dilation of the aorta, usually due to atherosclerosis, elevated blood pressure, or inflammation of the blood vessel. We include both abdominal and thoracic aortic aneurysms in our estimates of cause-specific mortality.
Aortic aneurysm was responsible for 3·32 million (95% UI 3·11–3·52) YLLs in 2019. There were 172 000 (157 000–183 000) deaths due to aortic aneurysms in 2019, an 82·1% (67·3–97·0) increase from 1990. Non-fatal burden is not currently estimated for aortic aneurysm.

ihme-appendicitis.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from an inflammation of the appendix.
17·7 million (95% UI 14·1–22·3) cases of appendicitis occurred in 2019, resulting in 33 400 deaths (27 300–38 100) and 1·50 million (1·24–1·71) global DALYs.

ihme-asthma.def:
Asthma is a chronic lung disease characterised by reversible airway obstruction due to spasms and secretions in the bronchi usually resulting from an allergic reaction or hypersensitivity and causing difficulty in breathing.
Asthma was responsible for 21·6 million (95% UI 17·1–27·0) DALYs in 2019, which was 20·8% (17·5–24·7) of total DALYs from chronic respiratory disease. Death rates from asthma were highest in countries of low and middle SDI, while prevalence was highest in high SDI countries.

ihme-atrialfibrillationandflutter.def:
Atrial fibrillation, a supraventricular arrhythmia due to progressive atriopathy, is defined by surface ECG diagnosis based on irregular RR intervals (in the absence of complete AV block) and no distinct P waves. Atrial flutter is defined by surface ECG diagnosis of atrial flutter waves.
There were 8·39 million (95% UI 6·69–10·5) DALYs due to atrial fibrillation and flutter in 2019, a 121·6% (111·5–132·0) increase from 1990. In 2019, there were 194 000 deaths (161 000–225 000) due to atrial fibrillation and flutter in females and 122 000 deaths (97 400–148 000) in males.

ihme-attentiondeficithyperactivitydisord.def:
ADHD is an externalising disorder, incorporating disability from persistent inattention and/or hyperactivity/impulsivity. DSM-IV-TR (314.0, 314.01) and ICD-10 (F90) criteria were used.
Attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) resulted in 1·03 million (95% UI 0·58–1·74) global DALYs in 2019. ADHD contributed to 0·8% (0·5–1·4) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

ihme-autismspectrumdisorders.def:
ASD are a group of neurodevelopmental disorders with onset occurring in early childhood. They incorporate disability from pervasive impairment in several areas of development, including social interaction and communication skills, along with restricted and repetitive patterns of behaviours or interests.
Autism spectrum disorders (ASD) resulted in 4·31 million (95% UI 2·82–6·23) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·2% (0·1–0·2) of DALYs. ASD contributed to 3·4% (2·7–4·3) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

ihme-bacterialskindiseases.def:
This aggregate cause includes death and disability resulting from cellulitis and pyoderma. Pyoderma refers to any skin disease that is pyogenic, and cellulitis is a skin disease marked by a bacterial infection that affects and spreads through the skin and soft tissues.
Globally, bacterial skin diseases were responsible for 2·20 million (95% UI 1·66–2·64) DALYs in 2019, with 551 000 (378 000–660 000) DALYs from cellulitis and 1·65 million (1·25–2.01) DALYs from pyoderma.

ihme-bipolardisorder.def:
Bipolar disorder is a mood disorder incorporating disability from manic, hypomanic, or major depressive episodes. Burden for bipolar disorder overall was estimated rather than by subtype. DSM and ICD criteria were used.
Bipolar disorder resulted in 8·50 million (95% UI 5·20–13·0) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·3% (0·2–0·5) of DALYs. Bipolar disorder contributed to 6·8% (4·9–9·1) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

ihme-bladdercancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the bladder, including ICD-10 codes such as C67.
There were 524 000 incident cases (95% UI 476 000–569 000), 229 000 deaths (211 000–243 000), and 4·39 million (4·09–4·70) DALYs due to bladder cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-blindnessandvisionloss.def:
Blindness and vision loss is a GBD cause aggregate of vision loss due to glaucoma, cataract, macular degeneration, refractive errors, near vision loss, and other eye diseases not estimated as part of another GBD cause.
Blindness and vision loss resulted in 22·6 million (95% UI 15·6–31·7) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 2·6% (2·2–3·2) of total global YLDs.

ihme-brainandcentralnervoussystemcancer.indicator: Brain and central nervous system cancer
ihme-brainandcentralnervoussystemcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the brain and central nervous system, including ICD-10 codes such as C70–C72.9.
There were 348 000 incident cases (95% UI 262 000–389 000), 246 000 deaths (186 000–271 000), and 8·66 million (6·72–9·57) DALYs due to brain and central nervous system cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-breastcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the breasts, including ICD-10 codes such as C50.
There were 2·00 million (95% UI 1·83–2·17) incident cases, 701 000 deaths (647 000–752 000), and 20·6 million (19·0–22·2) DALYs due to breast cancer globally in 2019. Among females, breast cancer was the ninth-leading Level 3 cause of death globally in 2019.

ihme-cardiomyopathyandmyocarditis.def:
This aggregate Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from cardiomyopathy and myocarditis. This group consists of the Level 4 causes alcoholic cardiomyopathy, myocarditis, and other cardiomyopathy.
Cardiomyopathy and myocarditis (CMP) was responsible for 9·14 million (95% UI 7·86–10·0) DALYs in 2019. In 2019, there were 2·30 million (1·78–2·94) prevalent cases of CMP in males and 1·76 million (1·35–2·30) prevalent cases in females.

ihme-cervicalcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the cervix, including ICD-10 codes such as C53.
There were 566 000 incident cases (95% UI 482 000–636 000), 280 000 deaths (239 000–314 000), and 8·96 million (7·55–9·98) DALYs due to cervical cancer globally in 2019. Among females, cervical cancer was the 21st-leading Level 3 cause of death globally in 2019.

ihme-chagasdisease.def:
Chagas disease is caused by infection with Trypanosoma cruzi, which is transmitted by Triatominae insect vectors, blood transfusion, organ transplant, and congenital transmission. Estimates include prevalent cases in non-endemic locations due to migration.
Chagas disease was responsible for 9490 deaths (95% UI 5500–16 500) and 275 000 DALYs (184 000–459 000) in 2019. Chagas is endemic in Latin American countries, but cases are also found in other locations due to migration.

ihme-chronickidneydisease.def:
This cause incorporates death and disability due to CKD defined as an estimated glomerular filtration rate less than 60 ml/min/1.73m2 or albumin to creatinine ratio >30mg/g. This includes those with end-stage kidney disease who are on dialysis or have had a transplant.
Chronic kidney disease (CKD) was responsible for 41·5 million (95% UI 38·3–45·0) DALYs in 2019. Age-standardised DALY rates were highest in central and Andean Latin America, at 1348·1 (1203·6–1521·6) and 836·3 (704·2–981·6) per 100 000, respectively (global rate was 514·9 [474·9–558·9]).

ihme-chronicobstructivepulmonarydisease.def:
COPD is a disease characterised by persistent respiratory symptoms and airflow limitation due to airway and/or alveolar abnormalities, usually caused by significant long-term exposure to noxious particles or gases. COPD includes emphysema and chronic bronchitis.
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) resulted in 74·4 million (95% UI 68·2–80·2) global DALYs and 71·9% (67·9–75·4) of total chronic respiratory disease DALYs in 2019.

ihme-cirrhosisandotherchronicliverdiseas.indicator: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases
ihme-cirrhosisandotherchronicliverdiseas.def:
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases are conditions in which liver cells are destroyed and replaced by fibrosis. Decompensated cirrhosis occurs when the liver can no longer compensate for the damage, and is marked by profound symptoms, health loss, and typically death in a few years.
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases resulted in 46·2 million (95% UI 43·0–49·6) global DALYs in 2019 and 1·8% (1·6–2·0) of global DALYs. Alcohol and hepatitis B and C contributed 24·2% (20·5–28·1), 23·3% (19·9–26·9), and 26·3% (22·9–30·5) of DALYs from cirrhosis, respectively.

ihme-colonandrectumcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the colon and rectum, including ICD-10 codes such as C18, C19, C20, and C21.
There were 2·17 million (95% UI 2·00–2·34) incident cases, 1·09 million (1·00–1·15) deaths, and 24·3 million (22·6–25·7) DALYs due to colon and rectum cancer globally in 2019. Colon and rectum cancer was the 15th-leading Level 3 cause of death globally in 2019.

ihme-conductdisorder.def:
CD occurs in those under 18 years of age and incorporates disability from antisocial behaviour that violates basic rights of others or major age-appropriate societal norms. DSM-IV-TR (312.81–312.89) and ICD-10 (F91) diagnostic criteria were used.
Conduct disorder (CD) resulted in 4·87 million (95% UI 2·74–7·62) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·2% (0·1–0·3) of DALYs. CD contributed to 3·9% (2·6–5·5) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

ihme-conflictandterrorism.def:
Conflict is armed violence between states, governments, and societies with destruction, mortality, and use of military forces. Terrorism is the unlawful or threatened use of force or violence against individuals to achieve political, religious, or ideological objectives.
Conflict and terrorism was responsible for 63 000 deaths (95% UI 57 200–69 300) in 2019. Of these deaths, 47 500 (43 100–52 300) occurred in locations with low SDIs and 34 (31–37) occurred in locations with high SDIs.

ihme-congenitalbirthdefects.def:
Congenital birth defects includes livebirths (ie, excludes stillbirths and pregnancy terminations) with any condition resulting from abnor-malities of embryonic development, excluding minor anomalies as defined by EUROCAT and defects arising from infections or substance abuse.
Congenital birth defects caused 549 000 deaths (95% UI 448 000–690 000) and was the fourth-ranked Level 3 cause of under-5 DALYs in 2019. The combined global incidence was 62·9 cases (54·0–73·3) per 1000 livebirths and 50·9 million (44·3–58·7) lived with birth defects in 2019.

ihme-cysticechinococcosis.def:
Cystic echinococcosis is a parasitic disease caused by infection with the Echinococcus granulosis tapeworm. Our estimates represent cases diagnosed in hospitals as well as in community surveys resulting in abdominal, pulmonary, or cerebral localisations.
Cystic echinococcosis (CE) was responsible for 1350 deaths (95% UI 987–1760) and 122 000 DALYs (89 200–169 000) in 2019. In central Asia, CE was the neglected tropical disease with the greatest burden, with 30 100 DALYs (15 300–54 400) in 2019.

ihme-cysticercosis.def:
Cysticercosis is a parasitic disease caused by Taenia solium. ICD-10 codes for cysticercosis are B69–B69.9. We model prevalence of neurocysticercosis with epilepsy.
The global burden of cysticercosis in 2019 was 1·37 million (95% UI 0·874–1·96) DALYs. In Latin America and the Caribbean, cysticercosis was the neglected tropical disease with the highest burden, with 287 000 DALYs (182 000–406 000).

ihme-decubitusulcer.def:
Decubitus ulcer, also known as pressure ulcer or sore, is an injury to the skin and underlying tissue resulting from an obstruction of blood flow due to pressure on the skin.
Globally, decubitus ulcer was responsible for 24 400 deaths (95% UI 17 300–31 300) and 3·17 million (2·88–3·50) incident cases in 2019.

ihme-dengue.def:
The estimates for dengue disease represent cases of clinically apparent illness (dengue fever, dengue haemorrhagic fever, dengue shock syndrome, and resulting chronic fatigue syndrome) and death. These estimates do not represent asymptomatic dengue virus infection.
Dengue was responsible for 36 100 deaths (95% UI 9180–44 500) and 2·38 million (0·828–3·27) DALYs in 2019. In southeast Asia in 2019, dengue had the highest DALY burden among all neglected tropical diseases and malaria.

ihme-depressivedisorders.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates disability from major depressive disorder (MDD) and dysthymia. MDD involves the experience of depressed mood or loss of interest or pleasure almost all day, every day, for two weeks. Dysthymia symptoms are less severe but chronic.
Depressive disorders resulted in 46·86 million (95% UI 32·93–63·80) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 1·8% (1·4–2·4) of DALYs. Depressive disorders contributed to 37·3% (32·3–43·0) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

ihme-dermatitis.def:
Dermatitis, or eczema, refers to inflammation of the dermal layer of the skin, with disruption of the epidermal barrier. This aggregate cause incorporates disability resulting from atopic, contact, and seborrhoeic dermatitis.
Globally, dermatitis was responsible for 10·1 million (95% UI 5·96–15·8) DALYs and 418 million (361–478) incident cases in 2019.

ihme-diabetesmellitus.def:
Diabetes mellitus is a chronic condition where either the pancreas does not produce enough insulin or the body is unable to metabolise insulin properly. Deaths and disability directly ascribed to diabetes are captured in the estimates for this cause. Other outcomes are captured under chronic kidney disease and risk estimates of elevated fasting plasma glucose.
Diabetes mellitus resulted in 70·9 million (95% UI 59·7–84·2) global DALYs in 2019, 2·8% (2·5–3·1) of total global DALYs.

ihme-diarrhealdiseases.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from diarrhoeal diseases for 13 different aetiologies. Diarrhoeal disease episodes were defined as three or more loose stools in a 24-hour period. Included are ICD-9: 001–009.9; ICD-10: A00–A09, R19.7.
In 2019, 6·58 billion (95% UI 6·05–7·14) incident cases and 99·0 million (92·1–106) prevalent cases of diarrhoeal diseases contributed to 1·53 million (1·09–2·22) deaths and 80·9 million (65·4–103) DALYs. The most DALYs occurred in children under 5 years (45·5 million [35·8–58·3]).

ihme-dietaryirondeficiency.def:
Dietary iron deficiency is defined as inadequate dietary intake of elemental iron leading to anaemia. Other conditions leading to iron deficiency are not included here, but instead with each underlying cause. Iron deficiency in the absence of anaemia is also not included.
In 2019, iron deficiency had a global prevalence of 14·4% (14·1–14·6) and accounted for 28·5 million (19·1–41·1) DALYs globally.

ihme-diphtheria.def:
Diphtheria is a bacterial infection caused by Corynebacterium diphtheriae.
In 2019, diphtheria caused 4370 deaths (95% UI 2940–6200) globally. Of these, 3650 deaths (2320–5370) occurred in children under age 5, of which 3500 (2190–5200) took place in sub-Saharan Africa.

ihme-drowning.def:
Drowning includes deaths and disability associated with unintentional immersion in water or another fluid. Cases due to water transport or natural disasters are assigned elsewhere. Included are ICD-10: W65–W70.9, W73–W74.9; ICD-9: E910–E910.99.
Drowning was responsible for 237 000 deaths (95% UI 215 000–262 000) in 2019. 88 100 deaths (76 500–102 000) occurred in those under age 20, constituting 37·1% (34·2–40·2) of all drowning deaths. Drowning was the 12th-leading Level 3 cause of death in 2019 in those under age 20.

ihme-drugusedisorders.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from opioid use disorder, amphetamine use disorder, cocaine use disorder, cannabis use disorder, and a residual category of other drug use disorders.
Drug use disorders caused 18·1 million (95% UI 14·3–22·0) DALYs, or 0·7% (0·6–0·9) of total DALYs in 2019. From 2010 to 2019, the all-age DALY rate due to drug use disorders increased by 11·5% (9·0–14·7). In 2019, 51·3% (49·6–53·3) of global drug use deaths were in the USA.

ihme-eatingdisorders.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates deaths and disability from anorexia nervosa (AN) and bulimia nervosa (BN). These are characterised by abnormal eating behaviours and concerns over food, eating, and body image (DSM-IV-TR 307.1, 307.51; ICD-10 F50.0, F50.2).
Eating disorders resulted in 2·91 million (95% UI 1·83–4·35) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·1% (0·1–0·2) of DALYs. It contributed to 2·3% (1·7–3·0) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

ihme-ebola.def:
Ebola virus is a relatively rare viral pathogen characterised by high case fatality. Clinical cases typically present initially as a febrile illness, which can be subsequently followed by haemorrhagic complications and death.
Ebola virus disease was responsible for 3680 deaths (95% UI 3020–4350) and 195 000 DALYs (160 000–231 000) in 2019, reflecting the 2018–2019 outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

ihme-encephalitis.def:
Encephalitis is a disease caused by an acute inflammation of the brain. Included in the GBD model were cases meeting ICD-10 diagnostic criteria for encephalitis: A83–A86.4, B94.1, F07.1, G04–G05.8.
Encephalitis was responsible for 89 900 deaths (95% UI 76 500–123 000) in 2019. 16 900 deaths (13 100–22 100) occurred in children under 5 years, comprising 0·3% (0·3–0·4) of all deaths for that population.

ihme-endocarditis.def:
The case definition for acute endocarditis was a clinical diagnosis of infective endocarditis—a bacterial or fungal infection of the heart, usually adherent to heart valves or chordae. The long-term sequelae of heart failure due to endocarditis are reported separately.
Endocarditis accounted for 66 300 deaths (95% UI 46 200–75 900) in 2019, a 131% (57·6–189) increase from 1990. In 2019, there were 610 000 incident cases (514 000–719 000) of acute endocarditis in males and 480 000 incident cases (402 000–575 000) in females.

ihme-endocrinemetabolicbloodandimmunedis.indicator: Endocrine, metabolic, blood, and immune disorders
ihme-endocrinemetabolicbloodandimmunedis.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from a residual group of conditions consisting mainly of thyroid disorders, rare metabolic and immune disorders, and blood disorders not resulting in anaemia.
There were 521 million (95% UI 459–594) prevalent cases of endocrine, metabolic, blood, and immune disorders (EMBID) in 2019, resulting in 162 000 deaths (131 000–179 000) and 22·9 million (17·0–30·0) global DALYs.

ihme-environmentalheatandcoldexposure.def:
Deaths or disability resulting from exposure to high or low temperatures in the environment, not including contact with fire, heat, or hot substances.
Environmental heat and cold exposure (EHCE) was responsible for 47 500 deaths (95% UI 32 200–54 400) in 2019. Age-standardised mortality rates decreased from 0·9 per 100 000 (0·7–1·0) in 2010 to 0·6 per 100 000 (0·4–0·7) in 2019.

ihme-esophagealcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the oesophagus, including ICD-10 codes such as C15.
There were 535 000 incident cases (95% UI 467 000–595 000), 498 000 deaths (438 000–551 000), and 11·7 million (10·4–12·9) DALYs due to oesophageal cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-executionsandpoliceconflict.def:
Police conflict and executions includes the lawful or threatened use of force or violence against individuals or groups of people or property in an attempt to achieve political or socioeconomic objectives for a state.
In 2019, age-standardised police conflict and executions death rates (per 100 000) were highest in north Africa and the Middle East (0·5 [95% UI 0·4–0·7]) and tropical Latin America (0·5 [0·3–0·6] ). Among high-income countries, rates were highest in the USA (0·4 [0·3–0·4]).

ihme-exposuretoforcesofnature.def:
A force that is beyond human control. This Includes earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, avalanches, storms, lightning strikes, and floods.
Exposure to forces of nature was responsible for 6080 deaths (95% UI 5520–6690) in 2019. Of these deaths, 2720 (2470–2990) occurred in locations with a low SDI and 219 deaths (199–241) occurred in locations with a high SDI.

ihme-exposuretomechanicalforces.def:
Unintentional death or disability resulting from contact with or threat of an animate or inanimate object, human, or plant. This category includes unintentional firearm injuries as well as other miscellaneous forces (eg, power tools or household machinery).
Exposure to mechanical forces was responsible for 122 000 deaths (95% UI 95 400–141 000) in 2019. Age-standardised mortality rates decreased from 1·9 per 100 000 (1·5–2·1) in 2010 to 1·6 per 100 000 (1·2–1·8) in 2019.

ihme-falls.def:
Falls includes death or disability resulting from a sudden movement downward due to slipping, tripping, or other unintentional movement that results in a person coming to rest at a lower level or against an object. Included are ICD-9: E880–E886.99, E888–E888.9, E929.3; ICD-10: W00–W19.9.
Falls was responsible for 753 000 deaths (95% UI 630 000–834 000) in 2019, an increase from 605 000 deaths (519 000–647 000) in 2010. Age-standardised death rates remained stable (decreased by 2·8% [-8·3 to 3·2]) between 2010 and 2019.

ihme-fireheatandhotsubstances.def:
Death or disability due to unintentional exposure to substances of high temperature, including hot liquid, solid, or gas such as cooking stoves, smoke, steam, drinks, machinery, appliances, tools, radiators, and objects radiating heat energy.
Fire, heat, and hot substances was responsible for 111 000 deaths (95% UI 88 200–132 000) in 2019, with an age-standardised mortality rate (ASMR) that decreased by 17·2% (5·3–25·2) from 2010 to 2019.

ihme-foodbornetrematodiases.def:
Our estimates represent infections with parasitic worms of the class trematode. We model infection and symptomatic illness for clonorchiasis, fascioliasis, fasciolopsiasis (intestinal fluke), opisthorichiasis, and paragonimiasis. 
Foodborne trematodiases were responsible for 780 000 DALYs (386 000–1 450 000) in 2019. They were the highest-ranking neglected tropical disease in east Asia in 2019.

ihme-foreignbody.def:
Unintentional death or bodily damage from an extraneous material or substance being within the body, including the airway, lungs, nose, and eyes.
Foreign body injuries were responsible for 6·47 million (95% UI 5·76–7·25) DALYs in 2019. The age group with the highest DALY rate in 2019 was early neonatal, which had an age-specific DALY rate of 8290 per 100 000 (6840–10 000) in 2019.

ihme-fungalskindiseases.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates disability resulting from tinea capitis, a fungal infection of the scalp and associated hair, and the residual group of other fungal skin diseases that are specifically not tinea capitis or onychomycosis.
Globally, fungal skin diseases were responsible for 3·22 million (95% UI 1·32–6·78) DALYs and 1·65 billion (1·49–1·81) incident cases in 2019.

ihme-gallbladderandbiliarydiseases.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from gallbladder and biliary diseases, such as gallstones, cholecystitis, and cholangitis.
193 million (95% UI 167–229) prevalent cases of gallbladder and biliary diseases occurred in 2019, resulting in 125 000 deaths (107 000–139 000) and 6·35 million (4·87–8·25) global DALYs.

ihme-gallbladderandbiliarytractcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the gallbladder and biliary tract, including ICD-10 codes such as C23 and C24.
There were 199 000 incident cases (95% UI 167 000–220 000), 172 000 deaths (145 000–189 000), and 3·62 million (3·10–3·97) DALYs due to gallbladder and biliary tract cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-gout.def:
Gout is a rheumatic disease that is characterised by deposition of monosodium urate (MSU) crystals in the synovial fluid of joints and in other tissues, causing inflammation. GBD uses the case definition of primary gout given by the American College of Rheumatology in 1977.
Gout resulted in 1·67 million (95% UI 1·07–2·39) global YLDs in 2019 and 0·2% (0·1–0·3) of total global YLDs.

ihme-guineawormdisease.def:
Dracunculus medinensis is a nematode that causes dracunculiasis, also known as Guinea worm disease. Guinea worm disease is characterised by the adult worm exiting the body, typically emerging from the lower extremities, causing pain and reduced mobility.
The global burden of Guinea worm disease in 2019 was 0·813 DALYs (95% UI 0·460–1·34), compared to the burden of 24 900 DALYs (15 600–36 800) in 1990, when large-scale eradication efforts began across Africa.

ihme-gynecologicaldiseases.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from uterine fibroids, polycystic ovarian syndrome, endometriosis, genital prolapse, premenstrual syndrome, menstrual disorders, and other gynaecological diseases (disorders of the breast, ovary, cervix, vagina, and vulva).
Gynaecological diseases caused a total of 8640 deaths (95% UI 4840–12 600) globally in 2019 and 39·6% (36·7–42·6) of all females—a total of 1·53 billion (1·41–1·64) persons—were living with gynaecological diseases in 2019.

ihme-hivaids.def:
The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) causes influenza-like symptoms during the acute period following infection, and can lead to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) if untreated. HIV attacks the immune system, leaving infected individuals more susceptible to opportunistic infections like tuberculosis. We do not distinguish between HIV-1 and HIV-2.
Globally in 2019, the number of HIV-related deaths was 864 000 (95% UI 786 000–996 000) and the number of new HIV infections was 1·99 million (1·76–2·26). The majority of this burden was seen in the sub-Saharan Africa super-region, which accounted for 74·0% (71·4–76·9) of global HIV-related deaths and 64·9% (61·1–69·1) of new HIV infections in 2019.

ihme-headachedisorders.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates disability resulting from migraine, tension-type headache (TTH), and their complication of medication overuse headache.
Headache disorders was responsible for 46·6 million (95% UI 9·77–100) YLDs, or 5·4% (1·1–10·6) of total YLDs in 2019. Migraine headache made up 88·2% (60·7–97·7) of the burden of headache disorders.

ihme-hemoglobinopathiesandhemolyticanemi.def:
This aggregate cause includes sickle cell disorders, thalassaemias, glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency, sickle cell trait, thalassaemia trait, hemizygous G6PD deficiency, and other haemoglobinopathies and haemolytic anaemias.
Haemoglobinopathies and haemolytic anaemias was responsible for 92 800 deaths (95% UI 77 000–115 000) in 2019, with 23 200 (15 700–33 200) in children under 5 years. It also caused 7·77 million (5·15–11·4) YLDs, which made it the 30th-ranked Level 3 cause of YLDs.

ihme-hodgkinlymphoma.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the lymph system (specifically Hodgkin disease), including ICD-10 codes such as C81.
There were 87 500 incident cases (95% UI 77 900–101 000), 27 600 deaths (23 700–31 800), and 1·15 million (0·977–1·32) DALYs due to Hodgkin lymphoma globally in 2019.

ihme-hypertensiveheartdisease.def:
Hypertensive heart disease is structural heart disease defined by its underlying cause (systemic hypertension), resulting in left ventricular hypertrophy, diastolic dysfunction, and clinical heart failure with either preserved or reduced systolic function.
Hypertensive heart disease resulted in 21·5 million (95% UI 16·4–23·9) global DALYs in 2019, and led to 496 000 deaths (345 000–558 000) in males and 661 000 deaths (505 000–750 000) in females.

ihme-idiopathicdevelopmentalintellectual.def:
This cause captures the health loss resulting from intellectual disability that arises from any unknown source.
Idiopathic developmental intellectual disability (ID) was responsible for 4·39 million (95% UI 2·30–7·24) YLDs in 2019. In South Asia, the age-standardised rate of YLDs for ID was 142·9 per 100 000 (80·7–228·5), nearly twice that of any other world region.

ihme-idiopathicepilepsy.def:
Idiopathic active epilepsy is characterised by recurrent, unprovoked seizures for which there is no identified underlying disease and is presumed to have a strong genetic basis. Our case definition includes cases of active epilepsy with at least one seizure in the previous five years, regardless of treatment.
Idiopathic epilepsy resulted in 13·1 million (95% UI 9·99–16·7) global DALYs in 2019 and 0·5% (0·4–0·6) of total global DALYs.

ihme-inflammatoryboweldisease.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability from ulcerative colitis, Crohn’s disease, and indeterminate cases of non-infectious inflammatory bowel disease—autoimmune diseases characterised by inflammation of the colon and gastrointestinal tract.
There were 4·90 million (95% UI 4·35–5·50) prevalent cases of inflammatory bowel disease in 2019, resulting in 41 000 deaths (34 900–44 700) and 1·62 million (1·36–1·92) global DALYs.

ihme-inguinalfemoralandabdominalhernia.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from hernias in which portions of the digestive tract protrude through defects in the walls of the abdominal cavity.
There were 32·5 million (95% UI 27·7–37·8) prevalent cases of inguinal, femoral, and abdominal hernia in 2019, resulting in 48 100 deaths (41 700–54 000) and 3·35 million (2·61–4·25) global DALYs.

ihme-interpersonalviolence.def:
GBD defines interpersonal violence as death or disability from intentional use of physical force or power, threatened or actual, from another person or group not including military or police forces. Included are ICD-9: E960–E969; ICD-10: X85–Y08.9, Y87.1–Y87.2.
Interpersonal violence was responsible for 415 000 deaths (95% UI 388 000–447 000) in 2019. 312 000 deaths (291 000–336 000) occurred in the 15–49 years age group, constituting 4·2% (4·0–4·5) of deaths and 4·6% (4·4–4·9) of YLLs for that population.

ihme-interstitiallungdiseaseandpulmonary.indicator: Interstitial lung disease and pulmonary sarcoidosis
ihme-interstitiallungdiseaseandpulmonary.def:
Pulmonary fibrosis and pulmonary sarcoidosis are the main diseases in this cause characterised by scarring in the lungs that makes it difficult to breathe.
Interstitial lung disease and pulmonary sarcoidosis (ILD) was responsible for 3·77 million (95% UI 2·86–4·47) DALYs in 2019. ILD was responsible for 3·6% (2·8–4·3) of all respiratory disease DALYs.

ihme-intestinalnematodeinfections.def:
Infections with intestinal nematodes, also known as soil-transmitted helminths, are caused by intestinal parasites: ascariasis (Ascaris lumbricoides), trichuriasis (Trichuris trichiura), and hookworm disease (Ancylostoma duodenale and Necator americanus). We model mortality due to ascariasis and non-fatal burden for all three helminthic diseases.
The global burden of intestinal nematode infections in 2019 was 2090 deaths (95% UI 1640–2640) and 1·97 million (1·26–3·00) DALYs.

ihme-invasivenontyphoidalsalmonellaints.def:
Non-typhoidal Salmonella (NTS) infections usually result in self-limiting diarrhoeal illness. iNTS occurs when NTS invades a normally sterile site (eg, blood) and most commonly presents as febrile illness with high case fatality.
594 000 cases (95% UI 486 000–718 000) of iNTS occurred in 2019, resulting in 79 000 deaths (43 000–124 000) and 6·11 million (3·32–9·71) global DALYs.

ihme-iodinedeficiency.def:
This cause incorporates disability due to visible goiter (grade 2) and associated sequelae, including thyroid dysfunction, heart failure, and intellectual disability. Sub-clinical iodine deficiency and non-visible goiter (grade 1) are not incorporated into these estimates.
In 2019, iodine deficiency had a global prevalence of 2·4% (95% UI 1·9–2·9) and accounted for 2·44 million (1·37–4·24) DALYs globally. Iodine deficiency led to 919 000 DALYs (526 000–1 560 000) in males and 1·52 million (0·843–2·70) DALYs in females in 2019.

ihme-ischemicheartdisease.def: IHD is defined as disease of the coronary arteries, usually from atherosclerosis, leading to myocardial infarction (MI) or ischaemia, following the Fourth Universal In 2019, ischaemic heart disease (IHD) was the second-leading Level 3 cause of global DALYs at 182 million (95% UI 170–194), a 50·4% (39·9–60·2) increase from 1990. IHD was responsible for 9·14 million (8·40–9·74) global deaths in 2019.

ihme-kidneycancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the kidneys, including ICD-10 codes such as C64 and C65.
There were 372 000 incident cases (95% UI 345 000–402 000), 166 000 deaths (155 000–176 000), and 4·05 million (3·80–4·32) DALYs due to kidney cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-larynxcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the larynx, including ICD-10 codes such as C32.
There were 209 000 incident cases (95% UI 194 000–225 000), 123 000 deaths (115 000–133 000), and 3·26 million (3·03–3·51) DALYs due to larynx cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-leishmaniasis.def:
Leishmaniasis is a disease caused by the Leishmania parasite, transmitted by phlebotomine sandflies. Visceral leishmaniasis is the most serious manifestation, characterised by swelling of the liver and spleen. Individuals with cutaneous leishmaniasis develop lesions that can result in permanent scarring.
Leishmaniasis was responsible for 5710 deaths (95% UI 1690–18 700) and 697 000 DALYs (375 000–1 620 000) in 2019.

ihme-leprosy.def:
The estimates for leprosy represent Grade 1 and Grade 2 cases. Grade 1 disability includes scarring or sensory impairment, and Grade 2 cases are characterised by ulcers, severe atrophy, or severe sensory impairment. 
The global burden of leprosy in 2019 was 28 800 DALYs (95% UI 18 600–42 000).

ihme-leukemia.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the blood and bone marrow (specifically leukaemia), including ICD-10 codes such as C91–C95.
There were 644 000 incident cases (95% UI 587 000–700 000), 335 000 deaths (307 000–360 000), and 11·7 million (10·5–12·7) DALYs due to leukaemia globally in 2019.

ihme-lipandoralcavitycancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the lips and oral cavity, including ICD-10 codes such as C00–C08.
There were 373 000 incident cases (95% UI 341 000–404 000), 199 000 deaths (182 000–218 000), and 5·51 million (5·00–6·03) DALYs due to lip and oral cavity cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-livercancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the liver, including ICD-10 codes such as C22.
There were 534 000 incident cases (95% UI 487 000–589 000), 485 000 deaths (444 000–526 000), and 12·5 million (11·4–13·7) DALYs due to liver cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-lowbackpain.def:
Low back pain is defined as pain in the area on the posterior aspect of the body from the lower margin of the twelfth ribs to the lower gluteal folds (with or without pain referred into one or both lower limbs) that lasts for at least one day.
Low back pain was the leading Level 3 cause of YLDs, responsible for 63·7 million (95% UI 45·0–85·2) YLDs, or 7·4% (6·2–8·7) of total global YLDs in 2019.

ihme-lowerrespiratoryinfections.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from LRI, including clinician-diagnosed and self-reported cases of pneumonia, bronchiolitis, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), and influenza-like illness.
In 2019, 489 million (95% UI 458–523) incident cases and 11·0 million (10·3–11·6) prevalent cases of lower respiratory infections (LRI) contributed to 2·49 million (2·27–2·74) deaths and 97·2 million (84·9–113) DALYs. The largest number of deaths occurred in the 70 and older age group (1·23 million [1·06–1·32] deaths).

ihme-lymphaticfilariasis.def:
LF is a disease in which threadlike nematodes invade the lymphatic system. The most prominent clinical manifestations are lymphoedema (a swelling of the extremities, also known in its more extreme manifestation as elephantiasis) and hydrocele (a collection of fluid in the sac around the testicles).
The global burden of lymphatic filariasis (LF) in 2019 was 1·63 million (95% UI 0·959–2·71) DALYs.

ihme-malaria.def:
This cause incorporates death and disability resulting from acute infection for both Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax and the long-term neurological consequences in a proportion of children who survive cerebral malaria.
Malaria was responsible for 643 000 deaths (95% UI 302 000–1 150 000) in 2019. 356 000 deaths (169 000–626 000) occurred in children under 5 years, comprising 7·1% (4·0–10·4) of total deaths in that age group.

ihme-malignantskinmelanoma.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the skin (specifically melanoma), including ICD-10 codes such as C43.
There were 290 000 incident cases (95% UI 214 000–342 000), 62 800 deaths (46 300–71 000), and 1·71 million (1·30–2·00) DALYs due to malignant skin melanoma globally in 2019.

ihme-maternaldisorders.def:
Fatal or non-fatal complications occurring during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period. Maternal deaths are due to obstetric complications or existing disorders exacerbated by pregnancy, up to one year post-pregnancy, excluding accidental and incidental deaths.
Maternal disorders was responsible for 196 000 deaths (95% UI 171 000–226 000) among females aged 10–54 in 2019, a 35·1% (25·4–45·4) decrease since 1990. There were 112 million (99·3–126) incident cases of maternal disorders in 2019, an 8·7% (5·9–11·3) decrease since 1990.

ihme-measles.def:
Measles is a contagious infection caused by the measles virus. Symptoms include cough, runny nose, fever, conjunctivitis, and red, blotchy skin.
Measles deaths declined from 802 000 deaths (95% UI 278 000–1 670 000) in 1990 to 83 400 deaths (31 000–180 000) in 2019. Still, 69 800 children (24 400–153 000) under 5 years died from measles in 2019; 78·2% (72·3–83·4) of these vaccine-preventable child deaths occurred in sub-Saharan Africa.

ihme-meningitis.def:
Meningitis is an inflammation of the meninges, the membrane surrounding the brain and spinal cord. Included in the GBD model were cases meeting ICD-10 diagnostic criteria for meningitis due to bacteria or viruses: A39–A39.9, A87–A87.9, D86.81, G00.0–G00.8, and G03–G03.8.
Meningitis was responsible for 236 000 deaths (95% UI 204 000–277 000) in 2019. 112 000 deaths (87 400–145 000) occurred in children under 5 years, comprising 2·2% (1·9–2·6) of deaths for that population.

ihme-mesothelioma.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the mesothelium, including ICD-10 codes such as C45.
There were 34 500 incident cases (95% UI 31 200–37 800), 29 300 deaths (26 700–31 000), and 668 000 DALYs (608 000–716 000) due to mesothelioma globally in 2019.

ihme-motorneurondisease.def:
Motor neuron disease is set of chronic, degenerative, and progressive neurological conditions typified by the destruction of motor neurons and the subsequent deterioration of voluntary muscle activity. Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is the most common motor neuron disease.
Motor neuron disease resulted in 1·03 million (95% UI 0·980–1·09) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 1·1% (0·6–1·9) of total global neurological disorder DALYs.

ihme-multiplemyeloma.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of plasma cells, including ICD-10 codes such as C90.0.
There were 156 000 incident cases (95% UI 137 000–173 000), 113 000 deaths (99 500–122 000), and 2·50 million (2·19–2·72) DALYs due to multiple myeloma globally in 2019.

ihme-multiplesclerosis.def:
Multiple sclerosis is a chronic, degenerative, and progressive neurological condition typified by the damaging of the myelin sheaths of nerves. As in previous rounds of GBD, diagnosis by clinical exam or published clinical and imaging criteria was considered the reference.
Multiple sclerosis resulted in 1·16 million (1·00–1·38) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 1·3% (0·7–2·0) of total global neurological disorder DALYs.

ihme-nasopharynxcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the nasopharynx, including ICD-10 codes such as C11.
There were 177 000 incident cases (95% UI 156 000–200 000), 71 600 deaths (65 400–77 600), and 2·34 million (2·14–2·54) DALYs due to nasopharynx cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-neckpain.def:
Neck pain is defined as neck pain (with or without pain referred into the upper limb[s]) that lasts for at least one day. The “neck” includes the area from the occiput to the first thoracic vertebra.
Neck pain resulted in 22·1 million (95% UI 14·5–31·7) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 2·6% (2·0–3·3) of total global YLDs.

ihme-neonataldisorders.def:
This aggregate cause covers five main causes of death and disability: preterm birth complications; neonatal encephalopathy due to birth asphyxia and trauma; neonatal sepsis and other neonatal infections; haemolytic disease and other neonatal jaundice; and other neonatal disorders.
Neonatal disorders were responsible for 1·88 million (1·61–2·24) deaths in 2019, making up 37·3% (35·6–38·8) of deaths in children under 5 years. Neonatal disorders were the second-leading Level 3 cause of YLDs among children and adolescents (<20 years).

ihme-nonhodgkinlymphoma.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the lymph system (specifically non-Hodgkin lymphoma), including ICD-10 codes such as C82-C86.
There were 457 000 incident cases (95% UI 417 000–499 000), 255 000 deaths (238 000–270 000), and 6·99 million (6·57–7·45) DALYs due to non-Hodgkin lymphoma globally in 2019.

ihme-nonmelanomaskincancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the skin, including ICD-10 codes such as C44. All deaths were mapped to squamous-cell carcinoma, while incident cases coded to C44 but without morphology codes were proportionally split to basal-cell and squamous-cell carcinoma.
There were 6·35 million (95% UI 5·81–6·95) incident cases, 56 100 deaths (50 400–59 800), and 1·18 million (1·09–1·26) DALYs due to non-melanoma skin cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-nonrheumaticvalvularheartdisease.def:
Non-rheumatic valvular heart disease is an aggregate of three Level 4 causes: calcific aortic valve disease, degenerative mitral valve disease, and other non-rheumatic valve diseases.
Non-rheumatic valvular heart disease (NRVD) caused 2·79 million (95% UI 2·52–3·13) DALYs in 2019, a 67·6% (55·1–80·8) increase from 1990. In 2019, NRVD led to 68 100 deaths (61 100–73 300) in males and 96 000 deaths (78 400–108 000) in females.

ihme-onchocerciasis.def:
Onchocerciasis, also known as river blindness, is a parasitic disease caused by Onchocerca volvulus. Diagnosis can be made by skin snip biopsy to identify larvae, surgical removal of nodules and exam for adult worms, slit lamp exam of anterior part of the eye where larvae or lesions caused by them are visible, and antibody tests.
The global burden of onchocerciasis in 2019 was 1·23 million (95% UI 0·765–1·82) DALYs.

ihme-oraldisorders.def:
Oral disorders comprises caries of deciduous and permanent teeth, chronic periodontal diseases, edentulism (total tooth loss), and other oral disorders (a heterogeneous group including a variety of tooth, tongue, and jaw disorders and malformations not included in the other causes).
Oral disorders was the tenth-ranked Level 3 cause of disability globally in 2019, causing 23·1 million (95% UI 13·6–37·4) YLDs. It was also ranked first and third globally for prevalence (3·48 billion [3·20–3·78] cases) and incidence (4·35 billion [3·89–4·84] cases) in 2019.

ihme-osteoarthritis.def:
OA is the most common form of arthritis, involving chronic inflammation, breakdown, and structural alterations of whole joints.
Osteoarthritis (OA) resulted in 18·9 million (95% UI 9·57–37·7) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 2·2% (1·3–4·1) of total global YLDs. OA knee, hip, hand, and other site contributed 60·9%, 5·5%, 23·5%, and 10·2% of OA YLDs, respectively.

ihme-othercardiovascularandcirculatorydi.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates less common cardiovascular diseases that are not modelled independently.
In 2019, 8·76 million (95% UI 7·84–9·82) DALYs were due to cardiovascular and circulatory diseases not otherwise specified in GBD. There were 146 000 deaths (129 000–161 000) due to this cause among females and 131 000 deaths (118 000–147 000) among males.

ihme-otherchronicrespiratorydiseases.def:
Other chronic respiratory diseases is a residual category of chronic respiratory diseases that are GBD causes.
Other chronic respiratory diseases was responsible for 2·86 million (95% UI 2·46–3·22) global DALYs in 2019.

ihme-otherdigestivediseases.def:
This residual cause encompasses a wide range of digestive diseases that do not map to other diseases in the GBD cause list, such as diverticulitis, polyps, haemorrhoids, hyperplasia of appendix, acute dilatation of stomach, and obstruction of duodenum.
Other digestive diseases caused 104 000 deaths (95% UI 84 400–119 000) and 2·50 million (2·12–2·80) global DALYs in 2019. These diseases are estimated to have also caused 319 000 YLDs (224 000–430 000).

ihme-otherintestinalinfectiousdiseases.def:
Other intestinal infectious diseases include intestinal infectious diseases other than diarrhoeal diseases, typhoid and paratyphoid, and invasive non-typhoidal Salmonella (iNTS).
Globally in 2019, there were 1400 deaths (95% UI 1000–1850) and 112 000 DALYs (79 200–149 000) due to other intestinal infectious diseases.

ihme-othermalignantneoplasms.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms not included in any other GBD cause, including ICD-10 codes such as C17, C30, C31, C40, C41, C47, C48, C51–C52.9, C57, C60, C63, C66, C68, C69, and C74.
There were 831 000 incident cases (95% UI 741 000–906 000), 408 000 deaths (355 000–444 000), and 13·4 million (12·0–14·6) DALYs due to other malignant neoplasms in 2019.

ihme-othermentaldisorders.def:
This residual cause incorporates disability from personality disorders, which are characterised by pervasive, inflexible, and maladaptive behaviour that is markedly different from what is considered culturally acceptable. DSM and ICD criteria were used.
Other mental disorders resulted in 8·65 million (95% UI 5·58–13·1) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·3% (0·2–0·5) of DALYs. They contributed to 6·9% (5·0–9·4) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

ihme-othermusculoskeletaldisorders.def:
Other musculoskeletal disorders is a heterogeneous rest category comprising a wide range of disorders of muscles, bones, and ligaments that are not included in the five GBD defined musculoskeletal diseases (RA, OA, low back and neck pain, and gout).
Other musculoskeletal disorders (MSK) resulted in 40·4 million (95% UI 28·2–55·5) global DALYs in 2019 and were responsible for 1·6% (1·2–2·1) of total global DALYs. 95·0% (92·7–96·6) of other MSK DALYs were years lived with disability (YLDs).

ihme-otherneglectedtropicaldiseases.def:
Other NTDs includes diseases encompassed by a total of 93 ICD-10 codes. The most prevalent conditions in this category are other viral haemorrhagic fevers (eg, Crimean-Congo and Marburg), mosquito-borne viruses (Chikungunya or West Nile), and typhus.
The global burden of other neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) in 2019 is 2·80 million (95% UI 1·93–4·47) DALYs, with the highest burden in India with 830 000 DALYs (95% UI 576 000–1 140 000).

ihme-otherneoplasms.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from all non-malignant neoplasms of sites not captured by another GBD cancer cause, such as benign and in situ neoplasms and myelodysplastic, myeloproliferative, and other haemopoietic neoplasms.
There were 282 million (95% UI 236–341) incident cases, 56 800 deaths (46 600–70 500), and 1·22 million (1·04–1·47) DALYs due to other neoplasms globally in 2019.

ihme-otherneurologicaldisorders.def:
Other neurological disorders is a residual category.
Other neurological disorders resulted in 4·26 million (95% UI 3·46–5·17) global DALYs in 2019 and were responsible for 4·7% (2·7–7·6) of total global neurological disorder DALYs.

ihme-othernutritionaldeficiencies.def:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability from less common nutritional deficiencies that are not modelled independently, including vitamin deficiency anaemias, thiamine, niacin, vitamin D, vitamin C, calcium, selenium, and folate deficiency.
Other nutritional deficiencies were responsible for 2·37 million (1·88–2·95) DALYs and 39 300 deaths (33 800–45 900) globally in 2019.

ihme-otherpharynxcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the pharynx (specifically other pharynx cancers not included in the GBD causes for mouth and nasopharynx cancer, such as cancers of the tonsils, oropharynx, and hypopharynx).
There were 167 000 incident cases (95% UI 153 000–180 000), 114 000 deaths (103 000–126 000), and 3·23 million (2·90–3·57) DALYs due to other pharynx cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-othersenseorgandiseases.def:
Other sense organ diseases is a residual category that captures both acute and chronic eye and ear conditions that do not map to other modelled diseases.
Acute and chronic other sense organ diseases resulted in 3·32 million (95% UI 1·97–5·13) global YLDs in 2019 and were responsible for 0·4% (0·3–0·5) of total global YLDs.

ihme-otherskinandsubcutaneousdiseases.def:
The other skin and subcutaneous diseases category encompasses a large group of skin conditions not captured in the other skin categories.
Globally, other skin diseases were responsible for 3·60 million (95% UI 1·77– 6·50) DALYs and 667 million (652–683) incident cases in 2019.

ihme-othertransportinjuries.def:
Death or disability due to injury sustained from transport other than automobile, motorcycle, pedal cycle, or other road vehicles.
Other transport injuries was responsible for 80 600 deaths (95% UI 67 600–89 000) in 2019. 45 000 deaths (37 500–50 300) occurred in the 15–49 years age group. There were 65 200 deaths (52 200–73 100) in males and 15 400 deaths (14 000–17 100) in females in 2019.

ihme-otherunintentionalinjuries.def:
Death or disability resulting from unintentional injuries not included in transport injuries or elsewhere in unintentional injuries. ICD10: W39-W39.9, W77-W77.9, W81-W81.9, X50-X58.9
Other unintentional injuries was responsible for 107 000 deaths (95% UI 83 300–119 000) in 2019. 62 200 deaths (48 200–70 000) occurred in the 15-49 year age group in 2019.

ihme-otherunspecifiedinfectiousdiseases.def:
Other unspecified infectious diseases include scarlet fever, other bacterial diseases, atypical viral infections of CNS, other viral infections, mononucleosis, rheumatic fever without heart involvement, other neonatal infections, and other infections in other organs.
Globally in 2019, there were 52·7 million (95% UI 51·7–53·6) prevalent cases of other unspecified infectious diseases, with 71 700 deaths (50 800–85 400).

ihme-otitismedia.def:
Otitis media is an infection of the middle ear space. Included in the GBD modelling were cases meeting ICD-10 diagnostic criteria H65–H75.83.
Globally in 2019, there were 119 million (95% UI 103–140) prevalent cases of otitis media, with 360 million (243–523) incident cases.

ihme-ovariancancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the ovaries, including ICD-10 codes such as C56.
There were 294 000 incident cases (95% UI 261 000–330 000), 198 000 deaths (175 000–218 000), and 5·36 million (4·69–5·95) DALYs due to ovarian cancer globally in 2019. Among females, ovarian cancer ranked as the 26th leading cause of death globally in 2019.

ihme-pancreaticcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the pancreas, including ICD-10 codes such as C25.
There were 530 000 incident cases (95% UI 486 000–574 000), 531 000 deaths (492 000–567 000), and 11·5 million (10·8–12·3) DALYs due to pancreatic cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-pancreatitis.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from inflammation of the pancreas; morbidity due to both acute episodes and chronic inflammatory changes is included.
2·81 million (95% UI 2·41–3·29) cases of pancreatitis occurred in 2019, resulting in 2·41 million (2·16–2·64) prevalent cases, 115 000 deaths (104 000–128 000), and 3·64 million (3·28–4·03) global DALYs.

ihme-paralyticileusandintestinalobstruct.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from a lack of digestive propulsion caused by failed peristalsis.
10·1 million (95% UI 9·75–10·4) cases of paralytic ileus and intestinal obstruction occurred in 2019, resulting in 239 000 deaths (199 000–266 000) and 7·08 million (5·65–8·25) global DALYs.

ihme-peripheralarterydisease.def:
Peripheral artery disease is a Level 3 cause defined as having an ankle-brachial index (ABI) of less than 0·90, with intermittent claudication defined as leg pain on exertion among those with an ABI below that threshold.
Peripheral artery disease (PAD) was responsible for 1·54 million (95% UI 1·01–2·37) DALYs in 2019. In 2019, there were 56·4 million (46·9–65·5) prevalent cases of PAD among those aged 40–70 and 57·0 million (95% UI 47·9–67·3) prevalent cases in those above age 70.

ihme-pneumoconiosis.def:
Pneumoconiosis is a lung disease caused by inhalation of various occupational dusts. This model combines silicosis, asbestosis, coal worker’s pneumoconiosis, and other pneumoconioses.
Pneumoconiosis was responsible for 479 000 YLLs (95% UI 418 000–551 000) and 440 000 YLDs (293 000–625 000) in 2019. Pneumoconiosis accounts for 0·9% (0·8–1·0) of overall chronic respiratory disease DALYs.

ihme-poisonings.def:
Unintentional exposure to a non-infectious substance which contacts or enters the body via inhalation, ingestion, injection, or absorption, and causes deranged physiological function or death.
Poisonings caused 77 200 deaths (95% UI 63 800–85 400) in 2019. The age-standardised mortality rate (ASMR) of poisonings deceased from 1·3 per 100 000 (1·1–1·4) in 2010 to 1·0 per 100 000 (0·8–1·1) in 2019; it was highest in 2019 in eastern sub-Saharan Africa.

ihme-prostatecancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the prostate, including ICD-10 codes such as C61.
There were 1·41 million (95% UI 1·23–1·83) incident cases, 487 000 deaths (420 000–594 000), and 8·64 million (7·55–10·6) DALYs due to prostate cancer globally in 2019. Among males, prostate cancer was the 18th-leading cause of death globally in 2019.

ihme-proteinenergymalnutrition.def:
Protein-energy malnutrition is health loss associated with moderate and severe acute wasting. PEM is further divided into moderate wasting without oedema, moderate wasting with oedema, severe wasting without oedema, and severe wasting with oedema.
Protein-energy malnutrition (PEM) caused 212 000 deaths (95% UI 185 000–246 000) in 2019, comprising 1·9% (1·5–2·2) of deaths among children under 5 years. PEM also caused 1·8% (1·4–2·2) of YLDs among children and adolescents (under 20 years).

ihme-pruritus.def:
Pruritus (or itching) can be a symptom of a condition or disease. This cause incorporates disability from cases meeting ICD-10 diagnostic criteria for pruritus (ICD-10: L29).
Globally, pruritus was responsible for 786 000 DALYs (95% UI 376 000–1 410 000) and 57·0 million (50·7–63·6) incident cases in 2019.

ihme-psoriasis.def:
Psoriasis is an autoimmune disease characterised by areas of raised, red skin with silvery scales, which may be itchy. It is an immune-mediated disease that involves inflammation and excess growth and abnormal behaviour of certain skin cells.
Globally, psoriasis was responsible for 3·51 million (95% UI 2·50–4·64) DALYs and 4·62 million (4·46–4·78) incident cases in 2019.

ihme-rabies.def:
Rabies is a viral infection transmitted by animal bite. We model symptomatic infections, not including those infections in which intervention prevented the onset of disease (ICD-10 code A82). Deaths due to rabies are reported via vital registration and verbal autopsy sources.
Rabies was responsible for 13 700 deaths (95% UI 6020–17 900) and 782 000 DALYs (320 000–1 080 000) in 2019.

ihme-rheumaticheartdisease.def:
RHD is a chronic autoimmune valvulitis due to rheumatic fever resulting from streptococcal pharyngitis. We defined RHD as a clinical diagnosis by a physician. Screening studies using echocardiography followed the World Heart Federation criteria for RHD.
In 2019, there were 10·7 million (95% UI 9·21–12·1) DALYs due to rheumatic heart disease (RHD). There were 306 000 deaths (259 000–340 000) due to RHD in 2019, a 15·6% (2·12–30·5) decrease from 1990.

ihme-rheumatoidarthritis.def:
RA is a systemic autoimmune disorder that causes pain, swelling, and deformation of the joints and may be accompanied by systemic symptoms. The reference case definition for RA is based on the 1987 criteria by the American College of Rheumatology.
Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) resulted in 3·26 million (95% UI 2·51–4·09) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 0·1% (0·1–0·2) of total global DALYs. 74·2% (65·8–80·6) of RA DALYs were due to YLDs.

ihme-roadinjuries.def:
Road injuries includes death or disability due to unintentional interaction with an automobile, motorcycle, pedal cycle, or other vehicles.
Road injuries was responsible for 1·20 million (95% UI 1·06–1·30) deaths in 2019. 650 000 deaths (578 000–711 000) occurred in the 15-49 year age group, constituting 8·8% (7·8–9·2) of deaths and 9·4% (8·4–9·9) of YLLs at those ages. Road injuries was the 13th-leading Level 3 cause in terms of age-standardised death rate in 2019.

ihme-scabies.def:
Scabies is a skin disease caused by the microscopic mite Sarcoptes scabiei. The main symptom is an itchy, pimple-like rash (ICD-10: B86).
Globally, scabies was responsible for 4·84 million (95% UI 2·68–7·73) DALYs and 565 million (499–634) incident cases in 2019.

ihme-schistosomiasis.def:
Schistosomiasis, also known as bilharzia or “snail fever,” is a helminth disease caused by infection with five species of the parasite Schistosoma: S. mansoni, S. japonicum, S. haematobium, S. mekongi, and S. intercalatum.
Schistosomiasis was responsible for 11 500 deaths (95% UI 10 100–13 300) and 1·64 million (1·04–2·64) DALYs in 2019, the majority of which occurred in sub-Saharan Africa.

ihme-schizophrenia.def:
Schizophrenia is a chronic psychotic disorder that involves positive symptoms (eg, delusions, hallucinations) and negative symptoms (eg, flat affect, loss of interest). DSM-IV-TR (295.10–295.30, 295.60, 295.90) and ICD-10 (F20) criteria were used.
Schizophrenia resulted in 15·1 million (95% UI 11·0–19·2) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·6% (0·4–0·7) of DALYs. Schizophrenia contributed to 12·2% (9·6–15·2) of total DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

ihme-selfharm.def:
Self-harm is deliberate bodily damage inflicted on oneself resulting in death or injury. ICD-9: E950–E959, ICD-10: X60–X64.9, X66–X84.9, Y87.0.
Self-harm caused 759 000 deaths (95% UI 685 000–832 000) in 2019 and 10·1% (9·2–11·1) of deaths in the 20–24 year age group. Age-standardised death rates decreased 16·5% (10·3–21·4) between 2010 and 2019. Self-harm was the 19th-leading Level 3 cause in terms of age-standardised death rate in 2019.

ihme-sexuallytransmittedinfectionsexclud.def:
STIs are viral, bacterial, or parasitic infections that are transmitted through sexual contact. This aggregate group includes syphilis, chlamydia, gonorrhoea, genital herpes, trichomoniasis, and a residual category of other sexually transmitted infections.
Sexually transmitted infections (STIs) that are not HIV resulted in 8·57 million (95% UI 3·79–16·5) global DALYs in 2019. Deaths from neonatal syphilis contributed 62·3% (47·9–70·4) of total DALYs in this category.

ihme-stomachcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the stomach, including ICD-10 codes such as C16.
There were 1·27 million (95% UI 1·15–1·40) incident cases, 957 000 deaths (871 000–1 030 000), and 22·2 million (20·3–24·1) DALYs due to stomach cancer globally in 2019. Stomach cancer was the 16th-leading cause of death globally in 2019.

ihme-stroke.def:
Stroke was defined according to WHO criteria of rapidly developing clinical signs of usually focal disturbance of cerebral function lasting more than 24 hours or leading to death. This Level 3 aggregate cause incorporates multiple Level 4 subtypes of stroke.
Stroke caused 143 million (95% UI 133–153) DALYs in 2019, which was 5·7% (5·1–6·2) of DALYs globally, making it the third-leading Level 3 cause of disease burden. There were 3·33 million (3·04–3·62) stroke deaths in males and 3·22 million (2·86–3·54) deaths in females in 2019.

ihme-suddeninfantdeathsyndrome.def:
SIDS is mortality in ages 7–364 days, where there is no clinical or pathological explanation for cause of death through any method, including an autopsy (ICD-10 R95).
Globally, sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) was responsible for 27 700 deaths (95% UI 12 100–60 900) in 2019. 2620 of these deaths (1480–4980) occurred in ages 7–27 days and 25 100 of these deaths (10 500–56 100) occurred in ages 28–364 days.

ihme-testicularcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the testes, including ICD-10 codes such as C62.
There were 109 000 incident cases (95% UI 93 400–129 000), 10 800 deaths (9960–11 900), and 562 000 DALYs (511 000–628 000) due to testicular cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-tetanus.def:
Tetanus is a serious bacterial disease with a high case fatality rate caused by the bacterium Clostridium tetani.
Tetanus caused 34 700 global deaths (95% UI 25 900–48 500) in 2019, with a disproportionate burden in low SDI countries. 40·2% (32·6–51·9) of tetanus cases and 46·4% (38·2–57·3) of deaths occurred in countries in the lowest SDI quintile.

ihme-thyroidcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the thyroid, including ICD-10 codes such as C73.
There were 234 000 incident cases (95% UI 212 000–253 000), 45 600 deaths (41 300–48 800), and 1·23 million (1·11–1·33) DALYs due to thyroid cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-trachealbronchusandlungcancer.def:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the trachea, bronchi, and lungs, including ICD-10 codes such as C33 and C34.
There were 2·26 million (95% UI 2·07–2·45) incident cases, 2·04 million (1·88–2·19) deaths, and 45·9 million (42·3–49·3) DALYs due to tracheal, bronchus, and lung cancers globally in 2019. Tracheal, bronchus, and lung cancers were the fifth-leading Level 3 cause of death globally in 2019.

ihme-trachoma.def:
Trachoma is a condition in which repeated infection with Chlamydia trachomatis results in inversion of the eyelashes, causing damage to the cornea. Trachoma burden is quantified in terms of vision loss and blindness.
The global burden of trachoma in 2019 was 181 000 DALYs (95% UI 114 000–274 000), the leading cause of preventable blindness worldwide.

ihme-tuberculosis.def:
TB is an infectious disease caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis. The definition includes pulmonary and extrapulmonary TB, which are bacteriologically confirmed or clinically diagnosed. In GBD, TB is an aggregate of drug-susceptible and drug-resistant TB among HIV-negative people.
Globally in 2019, as in 1990, tuberculosis (TB) was the leading Level 3 cause of death by a single pathogen. Among HIV-negative individuals, the number of TB deaths was 1·18 million (95% UI 1·08–1·29) and the number of incident cases of TB was 8·50 million (7·45–9·73).

ihme-typhoidandparatyphoid.def:
Typhoid and paratyphoid fevers result from systemic infection with Salmonella enterica serotypes Typhi and Paratyphi, respectively. They are characterised by febrile illness and, if severe, gastrointestinal bleeding, altered mental status, intestinal perforation, and death.
13·0 million (95% UI 8·37–19·6) cases of typhoid and paratyphoid fever occurred in 2019, resulting in 133 000 (65 700–229 000) deaths and 9·69 million (4·69–16·7) DALYs.

ihme-upperdigestivesystemdiseases.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death due to peptic ulcer disease, gastritis, and duodenitis, and disability resulting from peptic ulcer disease, gastritis, duodenitis, and gastro-oesophageal reflux disease.
Upper digestive system diseases resulted in 6·47 million (95% UI 6·02–7·08) YLLs in 2019, a decrease of 26·2% (19·0–33·0) since 1990. YLDs due to these diseases, however, rose by 66·4% (61·2–70·5) to 8·40 million (4·93–13·8) in 2019.

ihme-upperrespiratoryinfections.def:
Upper respiratory infections include cough, acute nasopharyngitis, sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis, laryngitis, tracheitis, epiglottitis, rhinitis, rhinosinusitis, rhinopharyngitis, and supraglottitis.
Globally in 2019, there were 17·2 billion (95% UI 15·4–19·3) incident cases and 237 million (212–265) prevalent cases of upper respiratory infections, contributing to 9460 deaths (5540–14 900) and 6·39 million (3·96–9·72) DALYs.

ihme-urinarydiseasesandmaleinfertility.def:
This Level 3 cause includes all urinary diseases specified in the GBD cause list (e.g., urinary tract infection, urolithiasis), male infertility, and other urinary diseases that do not map to GBD causes, such as urethral fistula and diverticulum of bladder.
All urinary diseases and male infertility together resulted in 9·34 million (95% UI 7·99–10·9) global DALYs in 2019 and were responsible for 0·4% (0·3–0·4) of total global DALYs.

ihme-urticaria.def:
Urticaria (hives) refers to a skin reaction that causes itchy, raised bumps. This cause incorporates disability from cases meeting ICD-10 diagnostic criteria for urticaria (ICD-10: L50).
Globally, urticaria was responsible for 3·90 million (95% UI 2·55–5·58) DALYs in 2019 and 115 million (101–129) incident cases in 2019.

ihme-uterinecancer.def:
This cause includes malignant neoplasms of the uterus and includes ICD-10 codes such as C54.
There were 435 000 incident cases (95% UI 397 000–480 000), 91 600 deaths (82 400–102 000), and 2·33 million (2·09–2·56) DALYs due to uterine cancer globally in 2019.

ihme-varicellaandherpeszoster.def:
Varicella (chicken pox) is an acute infectious disease caused by primary infection of the varicella-zoster virus. Herpes zoster (shingles) is caused by varicella-zoster virus reactivation in adults.
The global, age-standardised varicella and herpes zoster death rate declined by 47·6% (95% UI 40·9–53·6) from 1990 to 2019, to 0·2 deaths (0·2–0·2) per 100 000 in 2019. In 2019, most varicella-related deaths occurred in children under 5 years (5210 [4160–6480]).

ihme-vascularintestinaldisorders.def:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from ischaemic disorders and vascular malformations of the digestive tract.
1·46 million (95% UI 1·26–1·65) cases of vascular intestinal disorders occurred in 2019, resulting in 107 000 deaths (95 100–116 000) and 1·87 million (1·72–2·03) global DALYs.

ihme-viralskindiseases.def:
Viral skin diseases incorporates disability resulting from viral warts (raised growths on the surface of the skin caused by an infection with the human papillomavirus) and molluscum contagiosum (a viral infection of the skin causing waxy, dome-shaped nodules).
Globally, viral skin diseases was responsible for 4·73 million (95% UI 3·03–7·06) DALYs and 98·9 million (95·1–103) incident cases in 2019.

ihme-vitaminadeficiency.def:
This cause quantifies total vitamin A deficiency (defined as serum retinol <0.70 μmol/L) and disability from blindness and vision loss due to vitamin A deficiency.
In 2019, Vitamin A deficiency was responsible for 1·18 million (95% UI 0·805–1·64) DALYs globally, including 506 000 DALYs (337 000–720 000) in children under the age of 5.

ihme-whoopingcough.def:
Pertussis is a contagious respiratory disease caused by the bacterium Bordetella pertussis.
In 2019, there were 19·5 million (95% UI 14·9–24·8) cases and 117 000 deaths (53 500–212 000) due to whooping cough (pertussis) globally. Death rates were highest in children aged 28–364 days, but declined in this population by 56·1% (21·0–75·7) between 1990 and 2019.

ihme-yellowfever.def:
Yellow fever is an arbovirus that causes febrile illness that in some cases progress to severe jaundice, haemorrhage, and death. Yellow fever is a notifiable disease endemic in areas of South America and Africa.
The global burden of yellow fever in 2019 was 290 000 DALYs (95% UI 107 000–598 000) and 4280 deaths (1590–8840).

ihme-zikavirus.def:
Zika is a mosquito-borne virus that causes a mild febrile illness. In rare cases, Guillain-Barré syndrome or death can result. Congenital Zika syndrome represents a group of birth defects associated with infection during pregnancy, including microcephaly and motor impairments.
The global burden of Zika virus disease in 2019 was 347 DALYs (95% UI 256–455).

ohi-ao-future.def:
Artisanal Opportunities score (goal)
Predicted future status (based on contributions of pressures, resilience, and trend).

ohi-ao-pressures.def:
Artisanal Opportunities score (goal)
Cumulative pressures acting on a goal to reduce scores, used to calculate future status.

ohi-ao-resilience.def:
Artisanal Opportunities score (goal)
Average resilience variables acting on a goal to increase scores, used to calculate future status.

ohi-ao-score.def:
Artisanal Opportunities score (goal)
Final OHI score that takes into account current status and predicted future status.

ohi-ao-status.def:
Artisanal Opportunities score (goal)
Current status of goal based on current state relative to reference state.

ohi-ao-trend.def:
Artisanal Opportunities score (goal)
Predicted proportional change in status after five years, based on average change in status per year multiplied by five, used to estimate future status.

ohi-index-future.def:
The Ocean Health Index is a decision-making tool and framework for conserving the human-ocean ecosystem because people need a healthy ocean. The Index is the first assessment tool that scientifically measures key elements from all dimensions of the ocean’s health — biological, physical, economic and social — to guide decision makers toward the sustainable use of the ocean.
Predicted future status (based on contributions of pressures, resilience, and trend).

gggr-index.def: The Global Gender Gap Index was first introduced by the World Economic Forum in 2006 to benchmark progress towards gender parity and compare countries’ gender gaps across four dimensions: economic opportunities, education, health and political leadership. By providing country rankings, the report incentivizes comparisons across regions and countries and stimulates learning on the drivers of gender gaps and policies to close them.
