wdi2-SE.XPD.PRIM.ZS.def: Expenditure on primary education is expressed as a percentage of total general government expenditure on education. General government usually refers to local, regional and central governments.
wdi2-SE.XPD.PRIM.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.XPD.PRIM.PC.ZS.def: Government expenditure per student is the average general government expenditure (current, capital, and transfers) per student in the given level of education, expressed as a percentage of GDP per capita.
wdi2-SE.XPD.PRIM.PC.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.XPD.SECO.PC.ZS.def: Government expenditure per student is the average general government expenditure (current, capital, and transfers) per student in the given level of education, expressed as a percentage of GDP per capita.
wdi2-SE.XPD.SECO.PC.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.XPD.TERT.PC.ZS.def: Government expenditure per student is the average general government expenditure (current, capital, and transfers) per student in the given level of education, expressed as a percentage of GDP per capita.
wdi2-SE.XPD.TERT.PC.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi-EN.ATM.HFCG.KT.CE.units: thousand metric tons of CO2 equivalent
wdi-EN.ATM.HFCG.KT.CE.def: Hydrofluorocarbons, used as a replacement for chlorofluorocarbons, are used mainly in refrigeration and semiconductor manufacturing.
wdi-EN.ATM.HFCG.KT.CE.source: European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC)/Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (PBL). Emission Database for Global Atmospheric Research (EDGAR): http://edgar.jrc.ec.europa.eu/

wdi-IE.PPI.ENGY.CD.indicator: Investment in energy with private participation
wdi-IE.PPI.ENGY.CD.def: Investment in energy with private participation is the value of commitments to energy projects that have reached financial closure and directly or indirectly serve the public, including lease and management contracts, operation and management contracts with major capital expenditure, greenfield projects (in which a private entity or public-private joint venture builds and operates a new facility), and divestitures. Movable assets and small projects such as windmills are excluded.
wdi-IE.PPI.ENGY.CD.source: World Bank, Private Participation in Infrastructure Project Database (http://ppi.worldbank.org).

wdi2-SL.TLF.CACT.NE.ZS.def: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
wdi2-SL.TLF.CACT.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi-IE.PPN.ENGY.CD.indicator: Public private partnerships investment in energy
wdi-IE.PPN.ENGY.CD.def: Public Private Partnerships in energy (current US$)  is the value of commitments to energy projects that have reached financial closure and directly or indirectly serve the public, including lease and management contracts, operation and management contracts with major capital expenditure, and greenfield projects (in which a private entity or public-private joint venture builds and operates a new facility). It excludes divestitures and merchant projects. Movable assets and small projects are excluded.
wdi-IE.PPN.ENGY.CD.source: World Bank, Private Participation in Infrastructure Project Database (http://ppi.worldbank.org).

wdi2-SP.MTR.1519.ZS.units: % of women ages 15-19 who have had children or are currently pregnant
wdi2-SP.MTR.1519.ZS.def: Teenage mothers are the percentage of women ages 15-19 who already have children or are currently pregnant.

wdi2-SL.UEM.TOTL.FE.NE.ZS.def: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
wdi2-SL.UEM.TOTL.FE.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.TOTL.MA.NE.ZS.def: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
wdi2-SL.UEM.TOTL.MA.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.TOTL.NE.ZS.def: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
wdi2-SL.UEM.TOTL.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.1524.NE.ZS.def: Youth unemployment refers to the share of the labor force ages 15-24 without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
wdi2-SL.UEM.1524.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.ZS.indicator: Account ownership at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.ZS.def: Account denotes the percentage of respondents who report having an account (by themselves or together with someone else) at a bank or another type of financial institution or report personally using a mobile money service in the past 12 months (% age 15+).
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.ZS.source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2018, Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.FE.ZS.indicator: Account ownership at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.FE.ZS.def: Account denotes the percentage of respondents who report having an account (by themselves or together with someone else) at a bank or another type of financial institution or report personally using a mobile money service in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+).
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.FE.ZS.source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2018, Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.MA.ZS.indicator: Account ownership at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.MA.ZS.def: Account denotes the percentage of respondents who report having an account (by themselves or together with someone else) at a bank or another type of financial institution or report personally using a mobile money service in the past 12 months (male, % age 15+).
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.MA.ZS.source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2018, Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.OL.ZS.indicator: Account ownership at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.OL.ZS.def: Account denotes the percentage of respondents who report having an account (by themselves or together with someone else) at a bank or another type of financial institution or report personally using a mobile money service in the past 12 months (older adults, % of population ages 25+).
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.OL.ZS.source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2018, Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.40.ZS.indicator: Account ownership at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.40.ZS.def: Account denotes the percentage of respondents who report having an account (by themselves or together with someone else) at a bank or another type of financial institution or report personally using a mobile money service in the past 12 months (poorest 40%, share of population ages 15+).
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.40.ZS.source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2018, Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.PL.ZS.indicator: Account ownership at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.PL.ZS.def: Account denotes the percentage of respondents who report having an account (by themselves or together with someone else) at a bank or another type of financial institution or report personally using a mobile money service in the past 12 months (primary education or less, % of population ages 15+).
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.PL.ZS.source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2018, Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.60.ZS.indicator: Account ownership at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.60.ZS.def: Account denotes the percentage of respondents who report having an account (by themselves or together with someone else) at a bank or another type of financial institution or report personally using a mobile money service in the past 12 months (richest 60%, share of population ages 15+).
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.60.ZS.source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2018, Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.SO.ZS.indicator: Account ownership at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.SO.ZS.def: Account denotes the percentage of respondents who report having an account (by themselves or together with someone else) at a bank or another type of financial institution or report personally using a mobile money service in the past 12 months (secondary education or more, % of population ages 15+).
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.SO.ZS.source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2018, Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.YG.ZS.indicator: Account ownership at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.YG.ZS.def: Account denotes the percentage of respondents who report having an account (by themselves or together with someone else) at a bank or another type of financial institution or report personally using a mobile money service in the past 12 months (young adults, % of population ages 15-24).
wdi-FX.OWN.TOTL.YG.ZS.source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2018, Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

wdi2-SE.PRM.TENR.def: Adjusted net enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.
wdi2-SE.PRM.TENR.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.TENR.FE.def: Adjusted net enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.
wdi2-SE.PRM.TENR.FE.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.TENR.MA.def: Adjusted net enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.
wdi2-SE.PRM.TENR.MA.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.UNER.LO.ZS.def: Adolescents out of school are the percentage of lower secondary school age adolescents who are not enrolled in school.
wdi2-SE.SEC.UNER.LO.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.UNER.LO.FE.ZS.units: % of female lower secondary school age
wdi2-SE.SEC.UNER.LO.FE.ZS.def: Adolescents out of school are the percentage of lower secondary school age adolescents who are not enrolled in school.
wdi2-SE.SEC.UNER.LO.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.UNER.LO.MA.ZS.units: % of male lower secondary school age
wdi2-SE.SEC.UNER.LO.MA.ZS.def: Adolescents out of school are the percentage of lower secondary school age adolescents who are not enrolled in school.
wdi2-SE.SEC.UNER.LO.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.ZS.def: Children out of school are the percentage of primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school. Children in the official primary age group that are in preprimary education should be considered out of school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.FE.ZS.def: Children out of school are the percentage of primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school. Children in the official primary age group that are in preprimary education should be considered out of school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.MA.ZS.def: Children out of school are the percentage of primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school. Children in the official primary age group that are in preprimary education should be considered out of school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.def: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.FE.def: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.FE.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.MA.def: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.UNER.MA.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SL.EMP.TOTL.SP.FE.NE.ZS.def: Employment to population ratio is the proportion of a country's population that is employed. Employment is defined as persons of working age who, during a short reference period, were engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit, whether at work during the reference period (i.e. who worked in a job for at least one hour) or not at work due to temporary absence from a job, or to working-time arrangements. Ages 15 and older are generally considered the working-age population.
wdi2-SL.EMP.TOTL.SP.FE.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.EMP.TOTL.SP.MA.NE.ZS.def: Employment to population ratio is the proportion of a country's population that is employed. Employment is defined as persons of working age who, during a short reference period, were engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit, whether at work during the reference period (i.e. who worked in a job for at least one hour) or not at work due to temporary absence from a job, or to working-time arrangements. Ages 15 and older are generally considered the working-age population.
wdi2-SL.EMP.TOTL.SP.MA.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.EMP.1524.SP.FE.NE.ZS.def: Employment to population ratio is the proportion of a country's population that is employed. Employment is defined as persons of working age who, during a short reference period, were engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit, whether at work during the reference period (i.e. who worked in a job for at least one hour) or not at work due to temporary absence from a job, or to working-time arrangements. Ages 15-24 are generally considered the youth population.
wdi2-SL.EMP.1524.SP.FE.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.EMP.1524.SP.MA.NE.ZS.def: Employment to population ratio is the proportion of a country's population that is employed. Employment is defined as persons of working age who, during a short reference period, were engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit, whether at work during the reference period (i.e. who worked in a job for at least one hour) or not at work due to temporary absence from a job, or to working-time arrangements. Ages 15-24 are generally considered the youth population.
wdi2-SL.EMP.1524.SP.MA.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.EMP.1524.SP.NE.ZS.def: Employment to population ratio is the proportion of a country's population that is employed. Employment is defined as persons of working age who, during a short reference period, were engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit, whether at work during the reference period (i.e. who worked in a job for at least one hour) or not at work due to temporary absence from a job, or to working-time arrangements. Ages 15-24 are generally considered the youth population.
wdi2-SL.EMP.1524.SP.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SE.PRM.GINT.FE.ZS.indicator: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education
wdi2-SE.PRM.GINT.FE.ZS.def: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.
wdi2-SE.PRM.GINT.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.GINT.MA.ZS.indicator: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education
wdi2-SE.PRM.GINT.MA.ZS.def: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.
wdi2-SE.PRM.GINT.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.GINT.ZS.indicator: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education
wdi2-SE.PRM.GINT.ZS.def: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.
wdi2-SE.PRM.GINT.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi-DT.NFL.NIFC.CD.def: Nonguaranteed long-term debt privately placed from the International Finance Corporation (IFC). Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

wdi-IP.IDS.NRCT.indicator: Industrial design applications, nonresident, by count
wdi-IP.IDS.NRCT.def: Industrial design applications are applications to register an industrial design with a national or regional Intellectual Property (IP) offices and designations received by relevant offices through the Hague System. Industrial designs are applied to a wide variety of industrial products and handicrafts. They refer to the ornamental or aesthetic aspects of a useful article, including compositions of lines or colors or any three-dimensional forms that give a special appearance to a product or handicraft. The holder of a registered industrial design has exclusive rights against unauthorized copying or imitation of the design by third parties. Industrial design registrations are valid for a limited period. The term of protection is usually 15 years for most jurisdictions. However, differences in legislation do exist, notably in China (which provides for a 10-year term from the application date). Non-resident application refers to an application filed with the IP office of or acting on behalf of a state or jurisdiction in which the first-named applicant in the application is not domiciled. Design count is used to render application data for industrial applications across offices comparable, as some offices follow a single-class/single-design filing system while other have a multiple class/design filing system.
wdi-IP.IDS.NRCT.source: World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO), Statistics Database at www.wipo.int/ipstats/. The International Bureau of WIPO assumes no responsibility with respect to the transformation of these data.

wdi-IP.IDS.RSCT.indicator: Industrial design applications, resident, by count
wdi-IP.IDS.RSCT.def: Industrial design applications are applications to register an industrial design with a national or regional Intellectual Property (IP) offices and designations received by relevant offices through the Hague System. Industrial designs are applied to a wide variety of industrial products and handicrafts. They refer to the ornamental or aesthetic aspects of a useful article, including compositions of lines or colors or any three-dimensional forms that give a special appearance to a product or handicraft. The holder of a registered industrial design has exclusive rights against unauthorized copying or imitation of the design by third parties. Industrial design registrations are valid for a limited period. The term of protection is usually 15 years for most jurisdictions. However, differences in legislation do exist, notably in China (which provides for a 10-year term from the application date). Resident application refers to an application filed with the IP office of or acting on behalf of the state or jurisdiction in which the first-named applicant in the application has residence. Design count is used to render application data for industrial applications across offices comparable, as some offices follow a single-class/single-design filing system while other have a multiple class/design filing system.
wdi-IP.IDS.RSCT.source: World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO), Statistics Database at www.wipo.int/ipstats/. The International Bureau of WIPO assumes no responsibility with respect to the transformation of these data.

wdi2-SL.TLF.ACTI.1524.FE.NE.ZS.indicator: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24
wdi2-SL.TLF.ACTI.1524.FE.NE.ZS.def: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24 is the proportion of the population ages 15-24 that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
wdi2-SL.TLF.ACTI.1524.FE.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.ACTI.1524.MA.NE.ZS.indicator: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24
wdi2-SL.TLF.ACTI.1524.MA.NE.ZS.def: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24 is the proportion of the population ages 15-24 that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
wdi2-SL.TLF.ACTI.1524.MA.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.ACTI.1524.NE.ZS.indicator: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24
wdi2-SL.TLF.ACTI.1524.NE.ZS.def: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24 is the proportion of the population ages 15-24 that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
wdi2-SL.TLF.ACTI.1524.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.CACT.FE.NE.ZS.def: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
wdi2-SL.TLF.CACT.FE.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.CACT.MA.NE.ZS.def: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
wdi2-SL.TLF.CACT.MA.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SE.ADT.LITR.FE.ZS.def: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
wdi2-SE.ADT.LITR.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.ADT.LITR.MA.ZS.def: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
wdi2-SE.ADT.LITR.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.ADT.LITR.ZS.def: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
wdi2-SE.ADT.LITR.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.ADT.1524.LT.FM.ZS.def: Gender parity index for youth literacy rate is the ratio of females to males ages 15-24 who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
wdi2-SE.ADT.1524.LT.FM.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.ADT.1524.LT.FE.ZS.def: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
wdi2-SE.ADT.1524.LT.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.ADT.1524.LT.MA.ZS.def: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
wdi2-SE.ADT.1524.LT.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.ADT.1524.LT.ZS.def: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
wdi2-SE.ADT.1524.LT.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.CMPT.LO.FE.ZS.def: Lower secondary education completion rate is measured as the gross intake ratio to the last grade of lower secondary education (general and pre-vocational). It is calculated as the number of new entrants in the last grade of lower secondary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of lower secondary education.
wdi2-SE.SEC.CMPT.LO.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.CMPT.LO.MA.ZS.def: Lower secondary education completion rate is measured as the gross intake ratio to the last grade of lower secondary education (general and pre-vocational). It is calculated as the number of new entrants in the last grade of lower secondary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of lower secondary education.
wdi2-SE.SEC.CMPT.LO.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.CMPT.LO.ZS.def: Lower secondary education completion rate is measured as the gross intake ratio to the last grade of lower secondary education (general and pre-vocational). It is calculated as the number of new entrants in the last grade of lower secondary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of lower secondary education.
wdi2-SE.SEC.CMPT.LO.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi-EN.ATM.METH.ZG.def: Methane emissions are those stemming from human activities such as agriculture and from industrial methane production. Each year of data shows the percentage change to that year from 1990.
wdi-EN.ATM.METH.ZG.source: World Bank staff estimates from original source: European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC)/Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (PBL). Emission Database for Global Atmospheric Research (EDGAR): http://edgar.jrc.ec.europa.eu/.

wdi2-SE.PRM.NINT.ZS.def: Net intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the corresponding age.
wdi2-SE.PRM.NINT.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.NINT.FE.ZS.def: Net intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the corresponding age.
wdi2-SE.PRM.NINT.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.NINT.MA.ZS.def: Net intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the corresponding age.
wdi2-SE.PRM.NINT.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi-DT.ODA.OATL.KD.def: Net official aid refers to aid flows (net of repayments) from official donors to countries and territories in part II of the DAC list of recipients: more advanced countries of Central and Eastern Europe, the countries of the former Soviet Union, and certain advanced developing countries and territories. Official aid is provided under terms and conditions similar to those for ODA. Part II of the DAC List was abolished in 2005. The collection of data on official aid and other resource flows to Part II countries ended with 2004 data. Data are in constant 2018 U.S. dollars.
wdi-DT.ODA.OATL.KD.source: Development Assistance Committee of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Geographical Distribution of Financial Flows to Developing Countries, Development Co-operation Report, and International Development Statistics database. Data are available online at: https://stats.oecd.org/.

wdi-DT.ODA.OATL.CD.def: Net official aid refers to aid flows (net of repayments) from official donors to countries and territories in part II of the DAC list of recipients: more advanced countries of Central and Eastern Europe, the countries of the former Soviet Union, and certain advanced developing countries and territories. Official aid is provided under terms and conditions similar to those for ODA. Part II of the DAC List was abolished in 2005. The collection of data on official aid and other resource flows to Part II countries ended with 2004 data. Data are in current U.S. dollars.
wdi-DT.ODA.OATL.CD.source: Development Assistance Committee of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Geographical Distribution of Financial Flows to Developing Countries, Development Co-operation Report, and International Development Statistics database. Data are available online at: https://stats.oecd.org/.

wdi-DT.NFL.UNRW.CD.indicator: Net official flows from UN agencies
wdi-DT.NFL.UNRW.CD.def: Net official flows from UN agencies are the net disbursements of total official flows from the UN agencies. Total official flows are the sum of Official Development Assistance (ODA) or official aid and Other Official Flows (OOF) and represent the total disbursements by the official sector at large to the recipient country. Net disbursements are gross disbursements of grants and loans minus repayments of principal on earlier loans. Data are in current U.S. dollars.
wdi-DT.NFL.UNRW.CD.source: Development Assistance Committee of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Geographical Distribution of Financial Flows to Developing Countries, Development Co-operation Report, and International Development Statistics database. Data are available online at: https://stats.oecd.org/.

wdi-EN.ATM.NOXE.ZG.def: Nitrous oxide emissions are emissions from agricultural biomass burning, industrial activities, and livestock management. Each year of data shows the percentage change to that year from 1990.
wdi-EN.ATM.NOXE.ZG.source: World Bank staff estimates from original source: European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC)/Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (PBL). Emission Database for Global Atmospheric Research (EDGAR): http://edgar.jrc.ec.europa.eu/.

wdi-EN.ATM.GHGO.ZG.def: Other greenhouse gas emissions are by-product emissions of hydrofluorocarbons, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. Each year of data shows the percentage change to that year from 1990.
wdi-EN.ATM.GHGO.ZG.source: World Bank staff estimates from original source: European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC)/Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (PBL). Emission Database for Global Atmospheric Research (EDGAR): http://edgar.jrc.ec.europa.eu/.

wdi2-SH.STA.SMSS.ZS.indicator: People using safely managed sanitation services
wdi2-SH.STA.SMSS.ZS.def: The percentage of people using improved sanitation facilities that are not shared with other households and where excreta are safely disposed of in situ or transported and treated offsite. Improved sanitation facilities include flush/pour flush to piped sewer systems, septic tanks or pit latrines: ventilated improved pit latrines, compositing toilets or pit latrines with slabs.
wdi2-SH.STA.SMSS.ZS.source: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP) for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (washdata.org).

wdi2-SE.PRM.PRSL.FE.ZS.indicator: Persistence to last grade of primary
wdi2-SE.PRM.PRSL.FE.ZS.def: Persistence to last grade of primary is the percentage of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach the last grade of primary education. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.
wdi2-SE.PRM.PRSL.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.PRSL.MA.ZS.indicator: Persistence to last grade of primary
wdi2-SE.PRM.PRSL.MA.ZS.def: Persistence to last grade of primary is the percentage of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach the last grade of primary education. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.
wdi2-SE.PRM.PRSL.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.PRSL.ZS.indicator: Persistence to last grade of primary
wdi2-SE.PRM.PRSL.ZS.def: Persistence to last grade of primary is the percentage of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach the last grade of primary education. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.
wdi2-SE.PRM.PRSL.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.CMPT.FE.ZS.def: Primary completion rate, or gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education, is the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education. Data limitations preclude adjusting for students who drop out during the final year of primary education.
wdi2-SE.PRM.CMPT.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.CMPT.MA.ZS.def: Primary completion rate, or gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education, is the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education. Data limitations preclude adjusting for students who drop out during the final year of primary education.
wdi2-SE.PRM.CMPT.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.CMPT.ZS.def: Primary completion rate, or gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education, is the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education. Data limitations preclude adjusting for students who drop out during the final year of primary education.
wdi2-SE.PRM.CMPT.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRL.def: Primary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at primary level in public and private schools.
wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRL.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRL.FE.ZS.def: Female pupils as a percentage of total pupils at primary level include enrollments in public and private schools.
wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRL.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.TCHR.def: Primary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wdi2-SE.PRM.TCHR.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.TCHR.FE.ZS.def: Female teachers as a percentage of total primary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wdi2-SE.PRM.TCHR.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.PROG.ZS.def: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year (minus the number of repeaters from the last grade of primary education in the given year).
wdi2-SE.SEC.PROG.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.PROG.FE.ZS.def: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year (minus the number of repeaters from the last grade of primary education in the given year).
wdi2-SE.SEC.PROG.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.PROG.MA.ZS.def: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year (minus the number of repeaters from the last grade of primary education in the given year).
wdi2-SE.SEC.PROG.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.LO.TC.ZS.def: Lower secondary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in lower secondary school.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.LO.TC.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRE.ENRL.TC.ZS.def: Preprimary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in preprimary school.
wdi2-SE.PRE.ENRL.TC.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRL.TC.ZS.def: Primary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in primary school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRL.TC.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.TC.ZS.def: Secondary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in secondary school.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.TC.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.UP.TC.ZS.def: Upper secondary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in upper secondary school.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.UP.TC.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi-IS.RRS.GOOD.MT.K6.def: Goods transported by railway are the volume of goods transported by railway, measured in metric tons times kilometers traveled.
wdi-IS.RRS.GOOD.MT.K6.source: Internation Union of Railways (UIC), OECD Statistics

wdi-IS.RRS.PASG.KM.def: Passengers carried by railway are the number of passengers transported by rail times kilometers traveled.
wdi-IS.RRS.PASG.KM.source: Internation Union of Railways (UIC), OECD Statistics

wdi2-SL.TLF.CACT.FM.NE.ZS.indicator: Ratio of female to male labor force participation rate
wdi2-SL.TLF.CACT.FM.NE.ZS.def: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period. Ratio of female to male labor force participation rate is calculated by dividing female labor force participation rate by male labor force participation rate and multiplying by 100.
wdi2-SL.TLF.CACT.FM.NE.ZS.source: Derived using data from International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. The data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SE.PRM.REPT.FE.ZS.def: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.REPT.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.REPT.MA.ZS.def: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.REPT.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.REPT.ZS.def: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
wdi2-SE.PRM.REPT.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRE.ENRR.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Preprimary education refers to programs at the initial stage of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment and to provide a bridge between home and school.
wdi2-SE.PRE.ENRR.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRE.ENRR.FE.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Preprimary education refers to programs at the initial stage of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment and to provide a bridge between home and school.
wdi2-SE.PRE.ENRR.FE.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRE.ENRR.MA.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Preprimary education refers to programs at the initial stage of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment and to provide a bridge between home and school.
wdi2-SE.PRE.ENRR.MA.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRR.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRR.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.NENR.def: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wdi2-SE.PRM.NENR.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.ENR.PRIM.FM.ZS.def: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in primary education is the ratio of girls to boys enrolled at primary level in public and private schools.
wdi2-SE.ENR.PRIM.FM.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.ENR.PRSC.FM.ZS.def: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in primary and secondary education is the ratio of girls to boys enrolled at primary and secondary levels in public and private schools.
wdi2-SE.ENR.PRSC.FM.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRR.FE.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRR.FE.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.NENR.FE.def: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wdi2-SE.PRM.NENR.FE.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRR.MA.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wdi2-SE.PRM.ENRR.MA.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.NENR.MA.def: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wdi2-SE.PRM.NENR.MA.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.PRIV.ZS.def: Private enrollment refers to pupils or students enrolled in institutions that are not operated by a public authority but controlled and managed, whether for profit or not, by a private body such as a nongovernmental organization, religious body, special interest group, foundation or business enterprise.
wdi2-SE.PRM.PRIV.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRR.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRR.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.NENR.def: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wdi2-SE.SEC.NENR.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.ENR.SECO.FM.ZS.def: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in secondary education is the ratio of girls to boys enrolled at secondary level in public and private schools.
wdi2-SE.ENR.SECO.FM.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRR.FE.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRR.FE.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.NENR.FE.def: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wdi2-SE.SEC.NENR.FE.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRR.MA.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRR.MA.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wdi2-SE.SEC.NENR.MA.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.PRIV.ZS.def: Private enrollment refers to pupils or students enrolled in institutions that are not operated by a public authority but controlled and managed, whether for profit or not, by a private body such as a nongovernmental organization, religious body, special interest group, foundation or business enterprise.
wdi2-SE.SEC.PRIV.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.TER.ENRR.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether or not to an advanced research qualification, normally requires, as a minimum condition of admission, the successful completion of education at the secondary level.
wdi2-SE.TER.ENRR.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.ENR.TERT.FM.ZS.def: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in tertiary education is the ratio of women to men enrolled at tertiary level in public and private schools.
wdi2-SE.ENR.TERT.FM.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.TER.ENRR.FE.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether or not to an advanced research qualification, normally requires, as a minimum condition of admission, the successful completion of education at the secondary level.
wdi2-SE.TER.ENRR.FE.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.TER.ENRR.MA.def: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether or not to an advanced research qualification, normally requires, as a minimum condition of admission, the successful completion of education at the secondary level.
wdi2-SE.TER.ENRR.MA.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.GC.def: Secondary general pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in general education programs, including teacher training.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.GC.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.GC.FE.ZS.def: Secondary general pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in general education programs, including teacher training.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.GC.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.def: Secondary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at secondary level in public and private schools.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.FE.ZS.def: Female pupils as a percentage of total pupils at secondary level includes enrollments in public and private schools.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCHR.def: Secondary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCHR.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCHR.FE.ZS.def: Female teachers as a percentage of total secondary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCHR.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCHR.FE.def: Secondary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCHR.FE.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.VO.def: Secondary vocational pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in technical and vocational education programs, including teacher training.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.VO.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.VO.FE.ZS.def: Secondary vocational pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in technical and vocational education programs, including teacher training.
wdi2-SE.SEC.ENRL.VO.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020.

wdi-EN.ATM.SF6G.KT.CE.units: thousand metric tons of CO2 equivalent
wdi-EN.ATM.SF6G.KT.CE.def: Sulfur hexafluoride is used largely to insulate high-voltage electric power equipment.
wdi-EN.ATM.SF6G.KT.CE.source: European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC)/Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (PBL). Emission Database for Global Atmospheric Research (EDGAR): http://edgar.jrc.ec.europa.eu/

wdi2-SE.TER.TCHR.FE.ZS.def: Tertiary education, academic staff (% female) is the share of female academic staff in tertiary education.
wdi2-SE.TER.TCHR.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi-EN.ATM.GHGT.ZG.def: Total greenhouse gas emissions are composed of CO2 totals excluding short-cycle biomass burning (such as agricultural waste burning and savanna burning) but including other biomass burning (such as forest fires, post-burn decay, peat fires and decay of drained peatlands), all anthropogenic CH4 sources, N2O sources and F-gases (HFCs, PFCs and SF6). Each year of data shows the percentage change to that year from 1990.
wdi-EN.ATM.GHGT.ZG.source: World Bank staff estimates from original source: European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC)/Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (PBL). Emission Database for Global Atmospheric Research (EDGAR): http://edgar.jrc.ec.europa.eu/.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.LO.ZS.indicator: Trained teachers in lower secondary education
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.LO.ZS.def: Trained teachers in lower secondary education are the percentage of lower secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.LO.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.LO.FE.ZS.indicator: Trained teachers in lower secondary education
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.LO.FE.ZS.def: Trained teachers in lower secondary education are the percentage of lower secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.LO.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.LO.MA.ZS.indicator: Trained teachers in lower secondary education
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.LO.MA.ZS.def: Trained teachers in lower secondary education are the percentage of lower secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.LO.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRE.TCAQ.ZS.def: Trained teachers in preprimary education are the percentage of preprimary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.PRE.TCAQ.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRE.TCAQ.FE.ZS.def: Trained teachers in preprimary education are the percentage of preprimary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.PRE.TCAQ.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRE.TCAQ.MA.ZS.def: Trained teachers in preprimary education are the percentage of preprimary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.PRE.TCAQ.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.TCAQ.ZS.def: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.PRM.TCAQ.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.TCAQ.FE.ZS.def: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.PRM.TCAQ.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.PRM.TCAQ.MA.ZS.def: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.PRM.TCAQ.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.ZS.def: Trained teachers in secondary education are the percentage of secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.FE.ZS.def: Trained teachers in secondary education are the percentage of secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.MA.ZS.def: Trained teachers in secondary education are the percentage of secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.UP.ZS.indicator: Trained teachers in upper secondary education
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.UP.ZS.def: Trained teachers in upper secondary education are the percentage of upper secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.UP.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.UP.FE.ZS.indicator: Trained teachers in upper secondary education
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.UP.FE.ZS.def: Trained teachers in upper secondary education are the percentage of upper secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.UP.FE.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.UP.MA.ZS.indicator: Trained teachers in upper secondary education
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.UP.MA.ZS.def: Trained teachers in upper secondary education are the percentage of upper secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.
wdi2-SE.SEC.TCAQ.UP.MA.ZS.source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of September 2020.

wdi2-SL.UEM.1524.FE.NE.ZS.def: Youth unemployment refers to the share of the labor force ages 15-24 without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
wdi2-SL.UEM.1524.FE.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.1524.MA.NE.ZS.def: Youth unemployment refers to the share of the labor force ages 15-24 without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
wdi2-SL.UEM.1524.MA.NE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on June 15, 2021.

wdi-GC.DOD.TOTL.GD.ZS.def: Debt is the entire stock of direct government fixed-term contractual obligations to others outstanding on a particular date. It includes domestic and foreign liabilities such as currency and money deposits, securities other than shares, and loans. It is the gross amount of government liabilities reduced by the amount of equity and financial derivatives held by the government. Because debt is a stock rather than a flow, it is measured as of a given date, usually the last day of the fiscal year.
wdi-GC.DOD.TOTL.GD.ZS.source: International Monetary Fund, Government Finance Statistics Yearbook and data files, and World Bank and OECD GDP estimates.

wdi2-SP.REG.DTHS.ZS.indicator: Completeness of death registration with cause-of-death information
wdi2-SP.REG.DTHS.ZS.def: Completeness of death registration is the estimated percentage of deaths that are registered with their cause of death information in the vital registration system of a country.
wdi2-SP.REG.DTHS.ZS.source: World Health Organization, Global Health Observatory Data Repository/World Health Statistics (http://apps.who.int/gho/data/node.main.1?lang=en).

wdi2-SH.STA.BRTW.ZS.def: Low-birthweight babies are newborns weighing less than 2,500 grams, with the measurement taken within the first hour of life, before significant postnatal weight loss has occurred.

wdi-DT.NFL.MIBR.CD.def: Net financial flows received by the borrower during the year are disbursements of loans and credits less repayments of principal. IBRD is the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, the founding and largest member of the World Bank Group. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

wdi-DT.NFL.MIDA.CD.def: Net financial flows received by the borrower during the year are disbursements of loans and credits less repayments of principal. IDA is the International Development Association, the concessional loan window of the World Bank Group. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

wdi2-ST.INT.DPRT.def: International outbound tourists are the number of departures that people make from their country of usual residence to any other country for any purpose other than an activity remunerated in the country visited.
wdi2-ST.INT.DPRT.source: World Tourism Organization, Yearbook of Tourism Statistics, Compendium of Tourism Statistics and data files.

wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.ZS.dim: % of total working-age population with advanced education
wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.ZS.units: % of total working-age population with advanced education
wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.ZS.def: The percentage of the working age population with an advanced level of education who are in the labor force. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.FE.ZS.units: % of female working-age population with advanced education
wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.FE.ZS.def: The percentage of the working age population with an advanced level of education who are in the labor force. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.FE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.MA.ZS.units: % of male working-age population with advanced education
wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.MA.ZS.def: The percentage of the working age population with an advanced level of education who are in the labor force. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.TLF.ADVN.MA.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.ZS.dim: % of total working-age population with basic education
wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.ZS.units: % of total working-age population with basic education
wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.ZS.def: The percentage of the working age population with a basic level of education who are in the labor force. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.FE.ZS.units: % of female working-age population with basic education
wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.FE.ZS.def: The percentage of the working age population with a basic level of education who are in the labor force. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.FE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.MA.ZS.units: % of male working-age population with basic education
wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.MA.ZS.def: The percentage of the working age population with a basic level of education who are in the labor force. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.TLF.BASC.MA.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.ZS.dim: % of total working-age population with intermediate education
wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.ZS.units: % of total working-age population with intermediate education
wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.ZS.def: The percentage of the working age population with an intermediate level of education who are in the labor force. Intermediate education comprises upper secondary or post-secondary non tertiary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.FE.ZS.units: % of female working-age population with intermediate education
wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.FE.ZS.def: The percentage of the working age population with an intermediate level of education who are in the labor force. Intermediate education comprises upper secondary or post-secondary non tertiary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.FE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.MA.ZS.units: % of male working-age population with intermediate education
wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.MA.ZS.def: The percentage of the working age population with an intermediate level of education who are in the labor force. Intermediate education comprises upper secondary or post-secondary non tertiary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.TLF.INTM.MA.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.PART.FE.ZS.def: Part time employment refers to regular employment in which working time is substantially less than normal. Definitions of part time employment differ by country.
wdi2-SL.TLF.PART.FE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.PART.MA.ZS.def: Part time employment refers to regular employment in which working time is substantially less than normal. Definitions of part time employment differ by country.
wdi2-SL.TLF.PART.MA.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.TLF.PART.ZS.def: Part time employment refers to regular employment in which working time is substantially less than normal. Definitions of part time employment differ by country.
wdi2-SL.TLF.PART.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SH.H2O.SMDW.ZS.indicator: People using safely managed drinking water services
wdi2-SH.H2O.SMDW.ZS.def: The percentage of people using drinking water from an improved source that is accessible on premises, available when needed and free from faecal and priority chemical contamination. Improved water sources include piped water, boreholes or tubewells, protected dug wells, protected springs, and packaged or delivered water.
wdi2-SH.H2O.SMDW.ZS.source: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP) for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (washdata.org).

wdi-EN.ATM.PFCG.KT.CE.units: thousand metric tons of CO2 equivalent
wdi-EN.ATM.PFCG.KT.CE.def: Perfluorocarbons, used as a replacement for chlorofluorocarbons in manufacturing semiconductors, are a byproduct of aluminum smelting and uranium enrichment.
wdi-EN.ATM.PFCG.KT.CE.source: European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC)/Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (PBL). Emission Database for Global Atmospheric Research (EDGAR): http://edgar.jrc.ec.europa.eu/

wdi2-SL.UEM.NEET.FE.ZS.indicator: Share of youth not in education, employment or training
wdi2-SL.UEM.NEET.FE.ZS.def: Share of youth not in education, employment or training (NEET) is the proportion of young people who are not in education, employment, or training to the population of the corresponding age group: youth (ages 15 to 24); persons ages 15 to 29; or both age groups.
wdi2-SL.UEM.NEET.FE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.NEET.MA.ZS.indicator: Share of youth not in education, employment or training
wdi2-SL.UEM.NEET.MA.ZS.def: Share of youth not in education, employment or training (NEET) is the proportion of young people who are not in education, employment, or training to the population of the corresponding age group: youth (ages 15 to 24); persons ages 15 to 29; or both age groups.
wdi2-SL.UEM.NEET.MA.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.NEET.ZS.indicator: Share of youth not in education, employment or training
wdi2-SL.UEM.NEET.ZS.def: Share of youth not in education, employment or training (NEET) is the proportion of young people who are not in education, employment, or training to the population of the corresponding age group: youth (ages 15 to 24); persons ages 15 to 29; or both age groups.
wdi2-SL.UEM.NEET.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.ZS.dim: % of total labor force with advanced education
wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.ZS.units: % of total labor force with advanced education
wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.ZS.def: The percentage of the labor force with an advanced level of education who are unemployed. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.FE.ZS.units: % of female labor force with advanced education
wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.FE.ZS.def: The percentage of the labor force with an advanced level of education who are unemployed. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.FE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.MA.ZS.units: % of male labor force with advanced education
wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.MA.ZS.def: The percentage of the labor force with an advanced level of education who are unemployed. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.UEM.ADVN.MA.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.ZS.dim: % of total labor force with basic education
wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.ZS.units: % of total labor force with basic education
wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.ZS.def: The percentage of the labor force with a basic level of education who are unemployed. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.FE.ZS.units: % of female labor force with basic education
wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.FE.ZS.def: The percentage of the labor force with a basic level of education who are unemployed. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.FE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.MA.ZS.units: % of male labor force with basic education
wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.MA.ZS.def: The percentage of the labor force with a basic level of education who are unemployed. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.UEM.BASC.MA.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.INTM.ZS.dim: % of total labor force with intermediate education
wdi2-SL.UEM.INTM.ZS.units: % of total labor force with intermediate education
wdi2-SL.UEM.INTM.ZS.def: The percentage of the labor force with an intermediate level of education who are unemployed. Intermediate education comprises upper secondary or post-secondary non tertiary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.UEM.INTM.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.INTM.FE.ZS.units: % of female labor force with intermediate education
wdi2-SL.UEM.INTM.FE.ZS.def: The percentage of the labor force with an intermediate level of education who are unemployed. Intermediate education comprises upper secondary or post-secondary non tertiary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
wdi2-SL.UEM.INTM.FE.ZS.source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved on January 29, 2021.

wdi2-SL.UEM.INTM.MA.ZS.units: % of male labor force with intermediate education
